Job#: 3013272

Job Description:

Title: Automation Tester

Location: Cincinnati OH

Rate: 25-35/hr

This is a w2 role, we cannot offer sponsorship now or in the future.

Job Summary:

Responsibilities will include functional testing, load testing, usability testing, continuous integration and code reviews.

Primary Responsibilities:

Reviewing requirements, specifications and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback

Participate and contribute extensively to requirements analysis, design, QA test plan development, defect review, QA results analysis, sprint review, project planning sessions.

Estimating, prioritizing, planning and coordinating testing activities

Develop, document and maintain functional test cases and other test artifacts like test data, data validation and automated scripts

Execute and evaluate automated test cases and report test results

Perform risk assessments and business requirements validation

Investigate bugs and write clear and concise defect reports

Monitor, triage, and drive resolution of issues

Qualifications:

Technical Degree or related work experience

Experience with Automation Engineer (i.e. Selenium with Java or similar)

Experience in building and maintaining automated test frameworks (i.e. Java, Perl, ect)

Hands on experience Load/Integration testing/Security testing/Server-side testing

-Relational Database Development (MySQL, Microsoft SQL, Oracle, etc.)

Experience with Git version control and CI/CD tools

Experience with agile development

Job#: 3017035

Job Description:

Title / Position: Systems Administrator

Location: Charlotte, NC
Remote/Hybrid allowance: 4x/week onsite, 1/week remote

Contract Duration: 12+ months

Top Requirements:
Linux/Windows administration experience


This role is within the secure data movement team - which works on file transfers from this company to external vendors. The role involves system administration work as related to their file transfer platform which is cloud-based. The role includes monitoring tickets and logs within the platform as well as troubleshooting and maintenance of the platform. Daily responsibilities will be to uphold the standards of the organization from a security perspective and monitor/interpret metrics associated with the platform (success/failure, KPIs). Scripts are used to point transfers to correct buckets and automating services. Knowledge of protocols like SFTP, HTTPS (port 443) and LDAP would be advantageous. The team is looking for someone who is excited to learn and perform at a rigorous level.

Description

We are looking for an experienced Application Systems Analyst to join our team in Albuquerque, New Mexico. In this role, you will be responsible for evaluating, improving, and supporting application systems throughout their lifecycle, from initial requirements gathering to deployment and maintenance. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical and technical skills, with the ability to bridge the gap between business needs and technical solutions.

Responsibilities:

Define and refine business requirements, ensuring alignment with organizational goals.

Conduct thorough analysis of system logic and database structures to support enhancements.

Design, develop, test, and debug complex application components.

Provide support for application implementation, production environments, and upgrades.

Collaborate with business analysts and end users to develop detailed use cases and requirements.

Act as a liaison between technical teams and non-technical stakeholders to ensure clear communication.

Create and maintain user guides and technical documentation.

Run queries, analyze data, and develop data tools to support business needs.

Ensure compliance with DevOps practices and organizational standards.

Troubleshoot and resolve application issues to maintain system efficiency.

Other duties as needed



Interviews are currently being conducted, for immediate consideration please apply

Minimum of 4 years of experience in application systems analysis and/or development.

Proficiency in testing and supporting complex application systems.

Ability to work independently on intricate tasks with minimal supervision.

Strong knowledge of database management principles and system analysis.

Understanding of Applications architecture and integration is preferred

Familiarity with enterprise-level DevOps environments and methodologies.

Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent experience.

Excellent communication skills for both technical and non-technical audiences.

Advanced problem-solving and analytical abilities to address system challenges effectively.

Background required prior to employment.

Position: Desktop Support

Location: Orlando, FL (Hybrid)

Duration: Full time





Job focus, purpose, scope of responsibility. Three of the most important responsibilities.

Provides higher level IT support to remote (work-from-home), local, and remote offices workers. The Service Desk takes calls/emails, incidents directly from users and ensures all IT issues are resolved in a timely manner. Job Description:

C

Top Requirements:
Strong data analysis experience with focus on data architecture, data mapping, and data flows (not a reporting role)
Experience working with middle-office data and datasets
Understanding of front-office systems and how data flows to risk, finance, accounting, and operations
Knowledge of accounting and finance concepts (wholesale lending, mortgage securities, or capital markets terminology)







Wells Fargo is seeking a Data Analyst to support a high-visibility, revenue-generating initiative within the Corporate & Investment Bank. This role will focus on a new strategic data architecture supporting real-time data distribution and next-generation Data-as-a-Service capabilities. The analyst will work across multiple consuming applications to map data attributes, understand data flows, and support downstream use cases across risk, finance, accounting, and operations.

Data Governance Engineer
Mexico City, CDMX, Mexico
The candidate should be based in Mexico City (CDMX).
The Data Governance Engineer designs, builds, and operationalizes automated data governance controls across the bank s data platforms. This role focuses on embedding governance, data quality, lineage, and metadata directly into data pipelines and platforms by design, ensuring scalability, auditability, and regulatory compliance.

Job Title: Manhattan Active WMS Functional Consultant- Memphis, TN- onsite
Job Description:
Job Title- Manhattan Active WMS Functional Consultant
Location
Contract 1+ year
Manhattan Associates Active WMS (Warehouse Management System) as a Senior WMS System's Analyst.
Responsible for support of the Logistics Execution function (especially in the areas of Warehousing & Transportation).
Lead all aspects of the implementation, optimization & support of Global Logistics Execution processes & systems.
The initial focus will be on Manhattan Associates Active WMS and Oracle TMS (Transportation Management System) and the scope of logistics will span Inbound logistics (RMs), Replenishment logistics, and Distribution Logistics (DC's to Customers) across the globe.
Partner with Ops leadership & Finance to align the strategies and lead the process transformation to be world-class within and in support of the Logistics Execution function.
Own the Enterprise implementation, Solution architecture, and deployment of Manhattan WMS across DCs.
E2E Solution design in the logistics / Order to Deliver space including distribution, warehousing, transportation, and trade compliance functions.
Lead functional and technical discussions with the all-stake holders including the integration of WMS to other systems like e-Commerce, ERP, TMS, and other 3rd party vendor tools.
Lead projects by completing relevant analyses, simulating process, automation, and/or warehouse management configurations, warehouse controls, or execution changes to increase continuous product flow, improve efficiencies, and lower costs using appropriate IT Solutions.
Provide overall solution Governance to ensure global standardization (of business processed and solutions) for new projects, improvements, and break fixes.


Successful delivery of at least 2 large-size IT systems implementations as a WMS Manhattan Solutions Lead in Distribution and Logistics.
Direct experience delivering a supply chain distribution technology solution using WMS Manhattan, TMS/ERP (e.g., Manhattan, Oracle, SAP, BlueYonder).
Strong WMS SME with knowledge of Intelligent Fulfillment, Warehouse controls, Order Management, Inbound Processing, Outbound Processing, Physical Inventory, RF Transactions, cycle counting, and all other Manhattan integration(s).
Knowledge of TMS tactical planning and optimization, freight procurement, load design, asset-based/fleet-based routing and scheduling, appointment scheduling, multi-leg/multimodal shipping, intermodal and rail, multi-carrier parcel management.

Job#: 3012876

Job Description:

Senior Information Systems Security Engineer will lead security engineering and compliance efforts for enterprise programs. The role will design, implement, and sustain security controls across complex systems while guiding stakeholders through governance and risk processes.

Key Responsibilities:

- Architect, implement, and maintain security controls aligned to enterprise standards and regulatory frameworks.

- Conduct system security engineering across the lifecycle, including requirements, design reviews, integration, and operations.

- Perform risk assessments and recommend mitigation strategies for applications, networks, and cloud services.

- Develop and maintain security documentation, including plans, procedures, and diagrams.

- Support audits and compliance activities with evidence collection and remediation tracking.

- Coordinate with cross-functional teams, vendors, and client stakeholders to resolve security issues.

- Monitor emerging threats and recommend improvements to security posture.

Required Qualifications:

- Demonstrated experience as an Information Systems Security Engineer or similar security engineering role.

- Proficiency with security architecture, network security, endpoint protection, and identity and access management.

- Experience implementing security controls in enterprise or cloud environments.

- Knowledge of risk management, vulnerability management, and incident response practices.

- Strong documentation and communication skills.

Preferred Qualifications:

- Experience in telecommunications or large enterprise environments.

- Familiarity with NIST, ISO 27001, or similar frameworks.

- Relevant certifications such as CISSP, CISM, CISA, CEH, or cloud security certifications.

Equal Opportunity Statement:

All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to any protected characteristic. We encourage individuals of all backgrounds to apply.

Job#: 3016236

Job Description:

Location: Remote

Able to work any shift in a 24X7 rotation

Must haves:

8+ years experience in telecom network provisioning and grooming

Strong background with network turn downs, traffic migration, activations/ implementations, and maintenance

Well versed in related network technologies (Layer 1):

SONET (OC3, OC12, OC48, OC192)

TDM- Copper (DS0, DS1, DS3, SW voice trunks, PRI)

Experience with Ciena (4200, 6500, etc.), Fujitsu/ Flashwave SONET, Nortel MUX, Optera, and DXCs (Telabs, Alcatel, Titans)

Prior system experience (BGW, TCOMS, Maintenance Tracker, etc.)

Well versed on central office environments

Able to work morning/ mid/ or night shifts (24X7 schedule)



GIG- E, 10G, 100G, 400K, PIP



Looking for a Network Grooming/ Provisioning Engineer to sit remotely. You will primarily be prepping/ testing, grooming and provisioning the customers network, in an effort to migrate/ cut over traffic off of network elements that are being decommissioned for a central office. You will focus on layer 1 technologies (TDM/ SONET) but support other network technologies as needed based on what else the environment encompasses. Tasks will include collaborating with onsite techs at the central office/ client site, verify pathways to migrate traffic, and take action for maintenance/ activation/ implementation activities. Additional tasks will include partnering with internal teams to assist with additional guidance, provide updates and escalations to the assigned program leader, and scheduling tasks.

Job#: 3017040

Job Description:

A User Experience Architect is a user experience professional adept at planning and designing a consistent experience architecture of our customer facing interfaces and experiences across a spectrum of digital and real-world touchpoints. Partners with business analysts, developers, testers, product owners and compliance specialists to translate requirements into experience architectures.

Job Title: Core Engineering - Engineering Project Coordinator V
Job Description:
Job#: 3016839

Job Description:

JOB TITLE: Engineering Project Coordinator V

DURATION: 6 MON

LOCATION: ONSITE IN SUNNYVALE, CA

PAY RATE: $71 - $81 HOURLY

Description:

The main function of a project coordinator is to support project manager and project teams on a project. The coordinator ensures that no resources are being allocated to unnecessary tasks and that all aspects of the project are completed as quickly as possible.

Job Responsibilities:

Establishes and assembles project teams, and coordinates activities.

Develops detailed work plans, project estimates, status reports, project tracking and analysis.

Performs economic and other analysis as required to achieve the best least cost.

Manages critical milestones throughout the project to ensure the best customer experience.

Skills:

Verbal and written communication skills, multi-tasking, customer service skills and interpersonal skills.

Ability to work independently and manage one's time.

Ability to keep information organised and confidential.

Previous experience with computer applications, such as Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint.

Education/Experience:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent training required.

- Strong Programing/Coding Skills Preference for Python

- Design and implement automation solutions to streamline contact setups and validation processes.

Design application code, implement technical solutions, and configure applications in various environments in response to business issues.

Job#: 3016297

Job Description:

Targeted Years of Experience: 7+ years

Richardson, TX

Hybrid Work Schedule: Tues-Fri (8-5pm)

Strong background leading projects related to network turn downs, provisioning, grooming, activations/ implementations, and maintenance
Knowledgeable in related network technologies/ equipment (Layer 1):

SONET (OC3, OC12, OC48, OC192)

TDM- Copper (DS0, DS1, DS3, SW voice trunks, PRI)

Ciena (4200, 6500, etc.), Fujitsu/ Flashwave SONET, Nortel MUX, Optera, and DXCs (Tellabs, Alcatel, Titans)

Prior system experience (BGW, TCOMS, Maintenance Tracker, etc.)




Cisco/ Juniper Routers

GIG- E, 10G, 100G, 400K, PIP



Looking for a Network Grooming Program Manager in the Richardson, TX area. You will primarily be providing oversight for the client's large, decommissioning project to migrate traffic and remove all equipment/ services from a central office location. You will be partnering with executive leadership and your project team of engineers to prep, test, and perform maintenance on the broad range of network technologies that are current running in this location. By the end of 2026, or sooner, all routing must be diverted from the entire site. You will play a heavy hand in coordination and scheduling efforts for the team and ensure leadership is aware of any bottlenecks, delays, etc. You will provide read outs and status updates for leadership real time and on a weekly/ monthly basis, and ensure the project engineering team makes any adjustments needed based on demand. Additional tasks will include team member oversight/ management, coordinating with onsite contacts and creating/ managing project related to timelines, resourcing, process, access, etc.

Job Description:

Onsite Requirement:

An average of 40 hours per week with a blend of onsite and telework. Currently, a minimum of 2 days of onsite work per week is required, and telework is allowed 3 days a week. Depending on customer workload, there may be occasions when more than 2 days a week for onsite work will be required.

Required Certifications:

DoD 8570 IAT Level II (eg: CompTIA Security+, SSCP, etc )

Oracle Database Certification



Oracle DBA: This full-time Oracle database administrator position will challenge the candidate to expand their skillsets and learn new technologies in a fast-paced and friendly environment. The successful candidate remains up-to-date on vendor technologies and recommended best practices in a highly-available, enterprise environment. The successful candidate for this position will be solid in Oracle and familiar with MySQL and EDB PostgreSQL and will share "on call" rotation across a team of 5 DBAs.



Five or more years of experience (including design, installation, configuration, administration, patching, upgrades, tuning, backup and recovery, and troubleshooting) with Oracle Enterprise Database in a Linux environment on virtual servers; similar skills are desired for MySQL and EDB PostgreSQL

Oracle 19c including Multitenant, Real Application Cluster (RAC), Oracle Automatic Storage Management (ASM), Data Guard, Grid Infrastructure, Transparent Data Encryption (TDE), Oracle Net, Data Pump, Oracle Database Auditing, Container Databases, and Oracle Automatic Storage Management Cluster File System (ACFS)

Strong backup and recovery experience using Oracle Recovery Manager (RMAN) with Veritas NetBackup

Strong performance tuning experience for both transactional and analytical workloads

Strong troubleshooting experience utilizing database and operating system capabilities

Strong shell scripting experience in PL/SQL

Strong bash shell scripting experience in Oracle Enterprise Linux

Strong system administration experience

Strong documentation skills

Strong interpersonal skills

Participates in a 24x7 on-call support rotation



Databases: Oracle 19c or higher, MySQL 8 or higher, PostgreSQL 13.7 or higher

Experience with any of the following is beneficial

o Oracle Application Express

o Apache Tomcat

o Microsoft Azure

o Amazon AWS

Shell scripting experience in MySQL, and PL/pgSQL

Working knowledge of DoD Security Technical Implementation Guides (STIG) and Security Requirements Guides (SRG)

Job#: 3016718

Job Description:
Sample Tasks

Installation of IBM CICS and MQSeries and supporting products using the installation tools and steps required by the product vendor.

Maintenance of IBM CICS and MQSeries and supporting products using the installation tools and steps required by the product vendor.

Troubleshoot and resolve software issues for IBM CICS and MQSeries and supporting products such as application contention, program loops, short on storage conditions, MQ messages not reaching the intended destination, MQ Channels no starting, full MQ page sets.

Performance monitoring of IBM CICS and MQSeries and supporting products to ensure efficient CPU and I/O usage, transaction and MQ message throughput.

Application support for needed CICS Table updates, code rollout and for best practices and issues encountered in CICS, MQSeries, and supporting products usage.

Staff training of designated MNIT z/OS staff. Training will be provided by the mainframe and production support team.

Optimize mainframe performance

Provide technical leadership and mentoring

Maintain documentation and standards

Ensure compliance with security and accessibility policies

Test code to ensure it produces the desirable results and perform debugging when necessary

Provide application support and assistance on resolution of issues

Attend and participate in meetings and working sessions

Produce technical documentation

Complete assigned duties according to project plans and schedules

Provide testing and implementation of developed and configured elements

Conduct migration applications from development to QA to Production environments

Provide support of and participation in troubleshooting and resolving issues that arise

Provide knowledge transfer
Desired Skills

Experience with CICS, z/OS, SMP/E, Unix System Services

Experience in mainframe operating systems and maintenance

Experience Installing and maintaining CICS and MQSeries on z/OS including running commands or using MQ Explorer to manipulate Channels and Queues.

Experience in resolving CICS issues, including looping tasks and storage shortages.

Experience in IBM Job Control Language (JCL), JES2, (SMP/E or z/OSMF).

Knowledge of security within CICS and MQSeries (ACF2/RACF).

Ability to manage and maintain CICS definitions.

Knowledge of CICSPlex and CICS Transaction Gateway and able to analyze CICS Transaction and system dumps.

Strong problem-solving and analytical skills

Ability to lead projects and mentor others

Ability to effectively communicate with technical and non-technical staff

Experience with performance tuning and security certificate management

This job is responsible for preparing Design Change Packages in accordance with the Standard Design Change process, utilized unilaterally across the US Nuclear fleet. Additional engineering activities include supporting project implementation, development of test plans, performing Applicability Determinations and 50.59 Screening. Employees in this role apply broad nuclear plant engineering experience and principles to make decisions and recommendations. Serves as technical liaison within the nuclear business unit

Prepares and reviews Engineering Change packages per the Standard Design Process

Provide oversight for engineering vendor activities and perform owners' acceptance reviews on deliverables

Ensure successful implementation of all assigned projects and schedule ownership

Performs other job-related duties as assigned

Cyber Security Engineer

Apex Systems is hiring for multiple Cyber Security Engineers with a large Dept. of Defense client on-site in King of Prussia, PA!

Position requires a currently active Top Secret Security Clearance.

If interested in applying, please apply directly on our Apex website or email a copy of your updated resume AND certification(s) to Melissa at (please reference Job ID: 3016804)

On-site in King of Prussia, PA

12 months with option to extend (slated to go through 2030)



Responsible for applying an interdisciplinary, collaborative approach to plan, design, develop, validate and verify Cyber solutions across the lifecycle.

Conduct cyber risk assessment activities including threat modeling, vulnerability analysis and analysis of mitigation solutions.

Coordinates and addresses Supply Chain risk management concerns.

Develop, evaluate and analyze design constrains, trade-offs and detailed system and security design as they pertain to the Cyber domain.

Coordinate with Cyber and system architects and developers to provide oversight in the development of solutions.

Employs cyber security processes, methods, techniques and tools and assure their consistent application.

Job#: 3016703

Job Description:

Title / Position: Supply Chain Planner

Location: Charlotte, NC
Remote/Hybrid allowance: 4x/week onsite, 1x/week remote

Contract Duration: C2H
Typically will convert after 3 months, but could be longer










This Supply Chain Management role will include responsibility in analyzing and building corporate demand plans related to rented equipment that is on a return loop. The equipment that this team is responsible for is rented and in customers' homes until their contract ends. This person will be forecasting the demand plans, in relation to goals and metrics provided by other LOBs (i.e. marketing), which leads to establishing the purchasing budget and inventory management. Through managing an assortment of SKUs, this person will build the buy plan and understand what healthy inventory levels and trends look like as related to each specific piece of equipment. Each device that comes back into service has a different fall out rate, life expectancy, etc. This person should have excellent verbal and written communication as he/she will be expected to communicate with the team, vendors, and leadership through monthly presentations. The team has created big changes within the entire organization through implementing new approval processes with goals of cost reduction. Ideal candidates will have corporate retail sector experience and have handled a decide sized product volume.

Job#: 3016484

Job Description:

The Project Manager is responsible for all aspects of the project once the project is turned over for field execution. The size of the projects can range from 200 million to 1.5 billion dollars per project. All the project-associated departments (Development, BM, PC, Engr, ISC, etc.) answer to the PM during the field execution phase. Specifically, the PM is responsible for: 1) Staff and Employee Management; 2) Safety Management; 3) Contract Administration; 4) Project Management Planning; 5) Cost Management; 6) Time Management; 7) Quality & Schedule; 8) Commissioning and start-up of the facility; 9) Set-up of operations' readiness; 10) Public Relations and Corporation Communication's liaison at the site and community level. The PM will also act as the company representative with local, national, and international agencies and regulating entities during the execution phase.Education: Bachelor??s Degree in Engineering, Construction Management, Project Management, or a related field with Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification preferredRelevant Experience: 6 to 10 years of experience managing engineering and construction projects with responsibility for budget oversight and execution.Responsibilities: Supports project execution from field turnover to completion, overseeing contract administration, safety, and project timelines. Collaborates with engineering, procurement, and project management teams to ensure scope compliance and risk management.Other: Works on planning, scheduling, and quality management during project execution.

Job Title: Senior Technical Business Analyst / Data Architect
Job Description:
Hello
Hope You Are Doing Great,
Title: Senior Technical Business Analyst / Data Architect
Location: Chicago, IL (Hybrid)
Job Details:
We are seeking a highly experienced Senior Technical Business Analyst / Data Architect with a strong background in customer loyalty systems to lead the design, integration, and optimization of data and business solutions across our loyalty platform ecosystem. This hybrid role demands a unique blend of business acumen, systems thinking, and deep technical expertise in data modelling and architecture, particularly within loyalty or customer engagement environments.



This role will serve as a critical link between business stakeholders, technical teams, and data infrastructure, ensuring loyalty program requirements are translated into scalable, secure, and high-performance data solutions.



POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:



BUSINESS ANALYSIS RESPONSIBILITIES

Partner with stakeholders across product, marketing, CRM, and IT to gather, analyze, and prioritize business requirements related to loyalty program capabilities (e.g., accrual, redemption, tiering, member lifecycle).

Translate business needs into detailed technical specifications and solution designs.

Document system and process flows, data mappings, and interface specifications for loyalty system integrations.

Analyze loyalty program performance, customer data, and behavioral metrics to inform system design and enhancements.

Support stakeholder alignment by leading workshops and presenting solution designs.



DATA ARCHITECTURE RESPONSIBILITIES:

Lead the design and implementation of end-to-end data architectures supporting loyalty programs, including customer profiles, transactional history, engagement metrics, and campaign data.

Design and maintain conceptual, logical, and physical data models for loyalty ecosystems.

Define data integration strategies and oversee data flow design between loyalty platforms, CRM, POS, mobile apps, and enterprise data warehouses.

Ensure alignment of loyalty data models with enterprise architecture and data governance standards.

Collaborate with data engineers, developers, and DevOps teams to ensure solutions are robust, scalable, and optimized for performance.

Evaluate new loyalty platforms or enhancements and provide architectural recommendations.



OVERALL RESPONSIBILITIES:

Effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a fast-paced environment

Work both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment

Flexible and adaptable to learning and understanding new technologies

Highly self-motivated and directed

Demonstrate a commitment to Client core values









Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, or related field.

6+ years of experience in business analysis and data architecture roles, with significant focus on customer loyalty systems or CRM platforms.

Deep experience with loyalty business processes: point accrual/redemption, member tiers, campaign targeting, personalization, breakage analysis, etc.

Strong SQL skills and experience with cloud data platforms (e.g., Snowflake, BigQuery, Azure Synapse, AWS Redshift).

Proficiency in data modeling tools (e.g., ER/Studio, Lucidchart, dbt, ERwin).

Experience working with API integrations, event-based data pipelines, and microservices architecture.

Familiarity with enterprise loyalty platforms (e.g., Salesforce Loyalty, Oracle Loyalty Cloud, Comarch, SessionM, Annex Cloud, Kobie, etc.).

Experience with tools like Airbyte, dbt, Airflow, Fivetran, or Talend for data orchestration.

Proven ability to act as a bridge between technical teams and business stakeholders.

Strong documentation, communication, and presentation skills.



PREFERRED SKILLS:

Experience in high-volume, customer-centric industries (retail, travel, hospitality, QSR).

Familiarity with customer identity resolution, real-time personalization, or CDPs (Customer Data Platforms).

Understanding of data privacy and compliance regulations (GDPR, CCPA).

Knowledge of A/B testing, attribution modeling, and predictive analytics in loyalty contexts.



EDUCATION:

Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, or related field required and 6+ years of experience in business analysis and data architecture roles.

Job#: 3017325

Job Description:

Job Title: Sr Product Owner

Location: Remote- flexible hours PST or EST

Duration: 6+ months

Job Description:

We're seeking a Senior Product Manager to lead the design and delivery of complex, enterprise-grade restaurant software that enables scalable innovation across brands and markets.

This individual will combine deep customer empathy, technical acumen, and operational rigor to deliver solutions that transform the enterprise restaurant tech stack.



Product Strategy & Ownership

o Own the end-to-end product lifecycle for high-impact enterprise software solutions.

o Partner with engineering and operations to build scalable platforms that support the client global brand portfolio.

Product Execution & Delivery

o Translate product strategy into actionable release plans.

o Write clear user stories, acceptance criteria, and product requirements for b2b features.

o Partner with technical leads to scope work, manage trade-offs, and ensure timely delivery.

o Track KPIs and usage analytics to validate product success and inform iteration.

Stakeholder Collaboration & Communication

o Build trusted relationships with cross-functional stakeholders including brand leads, operations, legal, and finance.

o Serve as the voice of the customer and the business in agile ceremonies.

o Lead quarterly planning and product reviews, ensuring transparency and alignment with brand goals.

o Partner with enablement and support to ensure seamless go-to-market execution.

Customer & Market Understanding

o Use qualitative and quantitative insights to drive customer-centric product decisions.

o Balance enterprise customization needs with platform scalability and maintainability.



5+ years of experience in product management, preferably in enterprise SaaS or platform technology.

Proven ability to manage multiple product areas and scale solutions across diverse user groups.

Experience leading end-to-end product development in cross-functional, Agile teams.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Technical fluency to collaborate with engineering and make informed trade-offs.

Demonstrated track record of delivering user-focused, impactful enterprise products.

BA/BS degree required; MBA or technical degree preferred.

Job#: 3016396

Job Description:

Job Title: Integration/API Engineer

Location: Plano TX, Pennington NJ, Charlotte NC

Duration: 12 Months

Pay rate: $70.00 - $73.68/hr

Position Overview

We are seeking a highly skilled Integration/API Engineer who excels at building robust, scalable integrations across enterprise platforms. The ideal candidate combines strong engineering fundamentals with expertise in API development and event streaming technologies to enable seamless connectivity between ServiceNow, Kafka, and observability pipelines.



Design and implement API-based integrations between ServiceNow, Kafka, OTEL Collector, and other enterprise systems.

Develop and maintain webhook-driven workflows for real-time event processing and automation.

Engineer and optimize data flows for observability and monitoring pipelines, ensuring reliability and performance.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define integration requirements and deliver end-to-end solutions.

Develop automation scripts and tools using Python and Shell to support integration and DevOps workflows.

Create and maintain detailed documentation of integration architectures, API specifications, and operational procedures.

Strong engineering background with experience in API design and integration.

Proficiency in event streaming technologies such as Kafka and observability tools like OTEL Collector.

Advanced scripting skills in Python and Shell; familiarity with RESTful APIs and webhooks.

Understanding of ServiceNow platform and ITSM processes.

Ability to work independently and deliver complex integration solutions from concept to implementation.

Job#: 3016172

Job Description:

If you are interested in this opportunity please reach out to !

Robotics Lab Technician

Robotics Lab Technicians will help stand up the lab (hardware installation, station bring-up, and infrastructure buildout) and then own day-to-day upkeep, troubleshooting, and repairs once the lab is running at full scale.

Robotics experience is helpful but not required. What matters most is strong attention to detail, comfort working with tools, and the ability to follow procedures precisely.



Assemble and install lab equipment and test stations (benches, robots, cameras, PCs, wiring, peripherals).

Route and label cables cleanly and consistently according to documented standards.

Help bring new stations online: basic setup and simple functional checks.

Organize tools, parts, and inventory so the lab is easy to navigate and maintain.

Update build logs, checklists, and tracking sheets as work is completed.



Perform daily/weekly inspections to catch issues early (loose connections, wear, damaged components, misalignment).

Triage basic hardware issues (loose cables, failed peripherals, simple swaps) and escalate more complex problems.

Replace and repair components under guidance (cables, brackets, fixtures, sensors, etc.).

Keep stations tidy and ready for operators: reset workcells, restock consumables, handle minor adjustments.

Follow safety procedures and lock-out/tag-out practices when working on equipment.

Document all work for traceability.





Strong attention to detail: you notice when something is misaligned, mislabeled, or out of spec and you fix it.

Hands-on experience with tools (e.g., screwdrivers, hex keys, torque drivers, basic power tools).

Ability to follow detailed procedures, checklists, and build instructions accurately.

Comfort working around electromechanical systems (cables, power supplies, sensors, moving hardware).

Clear written and verbal communication; you keep others informed about issues and changes.

Reliability and ownership mindset: you take responsibility for your stations and follow through on tasks.



Experience in any of: robotics, automation, hardware labs, manufacturing, test engineering, or similar environments.

Basic familiarity with mechanical drawings, wiring diagrams, or assembly instructions.

Experience with 3D printers, test equipment, or lab measurement tools.

Basic troubleshooting skills for PCs and peripherals (USB devices, networking, cameras, etc.).

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to solve complex business challenges

Job#: 3016238

Job Description:

We are seeking a Cloud Security Engineer for a Banking client.

Please note this role will sit Remotely but must be within 50 miles of one of the following locations: Charlotte, NC, Raleigh, NC, Atlanta, GA or Richmond, VA.

Further details are below for review.

Details:

Client:Banking

Location:Work-from-Home

Length:12+ month Assignment

Pay:$75 - $80/hour W2



Wiz Platform Deployment & Ownership

CSPM, CWPP, CI/CD Integration & Remediation

Alerting, Monitoring & Incident Response Integration

Remediation, Ownership & Continuous Improvement

Cloud Security Engineering & Architecture playbook creation.

Leadership, Strategy & Governance

Develop and maintain the technical IT/cyber capabilities including all phases of the software development lifecycle and software stack which includes threat modeling of application designs, static application security testing (SAST), software composition analysis (SCA), dynamic application security testing (DAST), and penetration testing.

Lead efforts related to designing, planning, enhancing, and testing all Cloud cybersecurity technologies used throughout the enterprise including base-lining current systems, trend analysis, and capacity planning as required for future systems requirements and new technologies.

Analyze information to determine, recommend, and plan the use of new Cloud information security technologies, or modifications to existing equipment and systems that will provide capability for proposed project or workload, efficient operation, and effective use of allotted resources

Lead the implementation of new Cloud security technologies or integration of existing technologies including initial configuration, installation, change management, and operational handoff

Use sophisticated analytical thought through models, testing, and experience to exercise judgment and identify innovative solutions.

Responsible for technical support of Cloud security technologies providing expert problem analysis and resolution in a timely manner.

Creation of CI/CD automation leveraging Terraform for Cloud Security Services and Modules

Leads teams or projects with moderate resource requirements, risk, and complexity.



Deep specialized and/or broad functional knowledge in applied enterprise information security technologies including but not limited to firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention systems, network operating systems, identity management, database activity monitoring, encryption, content filtering, and Mainframe security.

Previous experience in leading complex IT projects.

Job#: 3016833

Job Description:

Apex Systems is seeking a Level 2 Systems Engineer to join an infrastructure team at one of our clients, providing services and software solutions to organizations across various industries.

Our mission is simple: to bring stakeholders together in a way that benefits everyone. Our web-based software solutions are designed to enhance performance management with complete transparency, concise measurements, and seamless data integration. We believe in the power of key performance indicators to drive improvement.

The Infrastructure team supports multiple environments, which comprise various applications and technologies used by the organization. These applications enable business interactions and support quality processes and associated procedures. It is a complex platform that captures, transmits, stores, hosts, retrieves, manipulates, and displays pertinent business information. The Infrastructure team plays a key role in ensuring consistent uptime for Non-Production and Production environments, which strongly influences the development and use of applications for business and technical teams. Specific work can include, but is not limited to, patching and upgrading infrastructure, maintaining and updating certificates, database changes, enhancing existing systems, providing restorative services, and supporting daily operations.

Job#: 3016888

Job Description:

Apex Systems is looking for an Electrical Design Engineer 5 to support one of our clients in Milpitas, CA! If interested, please email resume to

Position: Electrical Design Engineer 5

Length of Contract: 9 months

Location: 100% onsite in Milpitas, CA

Rate: $70-75/hr

Hours: 9 AM to 5 PM Monday-Friday

Team Structure:

The role is part of a large central engineering team supporting multiple divisions, about 60 people split evenly between electrical and mechanical. Current projects include system interlocks for laser and control, designing control circuits for hardware, and PLC programming for firmware integration. Work model is hybrid for most of the team, but electrical engineers are expected to be onsite daily (100% onsite required). Occasional remote work for schematic tasks is acceptable.

Day-to-day responsibilities:

Include gathering requirements from functional teams, creating and presenting requirement documents for approval, concept design, stakeholder and detailed design reviews, overseeing part assembly (contractors build assemblies), testing on tools, firmware testing, and handoff to manufacturing.

Design tools can be AutoCAD or ORCAD for schematic creation only; board design is not required. FPGA engineers with strong programming skills can transition well to PLC programming. Limited time for training, so candidates must be ready to contribute quickly.

Requirements:

Top requirement is .

Candidates should have a BS or MS degree and 5-7 years of experience (minimum 5 years required, strong 4-year experience may be considered).

Power distribution design experience is a plus, along with strong electrical engineering fundamentals.

Job#: 3015610

Job Description:

This position will have the responsibility and authority to schedule and dispatch FPL generation resources to economically balance load and generation in order to meet real-time system conditions and to comply with applicable regulatory requirements and NERC reliability standards. This position is also responsible to evaluate and approve OASIS requests and Tags and for performing energy accounting functions. Also, has capability to perform next-day generation planning function and can perform, on a temporary basis, certain system operator functions whenever the on-shift System Operator is away from desk (bathroom breaks, etc.). Responsible for planning, scheduling, and tracking, ensuring compliance with operational and regulatory requirements. Develops work orders, ensures coordination between operations, and leads scheduling processes for maintenance, compliance, and project execution. Evaluates and improves work management execution, participates in event response, and leads root cause analysis for operational efficiency improvements. Coordinates committing, decommitting, and outages of power plants with FPL?s System Operator and PGBU. Ensures rapid recovery from loss of generation to comply with NERC requirements. Performs hourly and on-peak/off-peak energy accounting functions with adjacent balancing authorities.Education: Bachelor's degree in Engineering or professional certification required.Relevant Experience: 15+ years of experience in advanced scheduling, power system operations, and project coordination within FPL and PGBU.Responsibilities: Oversees strategic planning and scheduling efforts, ensuring regulatory compliance and optimizing load-generation balance. Provides technical leadership in power system forecasting, emergency planning, and compliance with industry regulations. Develops, submits, and modifies monthly Tags for FPL?s dynamic schedules.Other: Extensive experience in NERC-certified operations, outage planning, and operational risk management; Power Coordinator Certification preferred.

Job#: 3017161

Job Description:

Title / Position: Senior Technical Business Analyst

Location: Charlotte, NC
Remote/Hybrid allowance: 4x/week onsite, 1/week remote

Contract Duration: 3 months

Requirements:
Traditional BA skills - writing and gathering requirements, stakeholder communication





The role is within a customer experience team - the team advocates for the customer as related to call center practices. The company is utilizing AI to improve their capabilities in predictive calling by making more information available to agents prior to the customer being on the line. Goals include faster, cleaner resolutions and in turn, happier customers. This particular role will be focused on building a new bot using agentic AI to facilitate the sales process. This bot will be trained to gather all information necessary to start a sale (i.e. name, address, types of services requested, etc.). This person will act as a BA/PO to own their respective bots within the IVR. This will include gathering requirements from stakeholders, documentation, helping designers build the customer experience, and conducting UAT testing to ensure a product/experience has been designed to do what it should. This person will work through requirements to catch bugs and bring them up to date to ensure that what has been presented to stakeholders is what is being executed in the IVR. Ideal candidates will have experience writing user stories, using Visio to draft customer journeys and be familiar with SQL to quantify their BRD requests. The team is seeking a creative thinker - someone who desires to utilize technology to work smarter and has a natural curiosity to problem solve.

Job#: 3014755

Job Description:

How You Will Make a Difference:

1. Collaborate with information technology and other business unit personnel to identify cybersecurity risks associated with highly complex projects and other business initiatives.

2. Perform assessments of external party information security controls to ensure they meet or exceed VF's information security risk management requirements for the services to be provided.

3. Determine information security risk profiles for various vendor and business partner services using questionnaires, relevant industry best practices and standards, and knowledge of VF policies.

4. Recommend solutions to eliminate, reduce, or mitigate cybersecurity risk, and communicate said solutions to external parties and/or internal business stakeholders as appropriate.

5. Provide direction and guidance as needed to internal project stakeholders concerning statutory, regulatory, and VF policy and program requirements.

6. Record pertinent documentation and communications for all assessments in VF's online information technology risk management platform.

7. Report status of engagements to Global Cyber and Information Security management, project managers, and other business stakeholders as appropriate.

Sensitivity: Public

POSITION DESCRIPTION


5+ years



5+ years of information security risk management and/or IT audit experience, preferably in a large corporate enterprise.

Bachelor's degree in information systems, computer science, or related field preferred.

Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) preferred. Certified Information Security Manager (CISM), Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA), Certified in Risk and Information Systems Control (CRISC) or similar credentials considered.

Functional knowledge of industry frameworks, regulations, legislation, and audit methodologies, including SOC 1, SOC 2, ISO 27000, SIG, CAIQ, NIST Cybersecurity Framework, Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX), PCI-DSS, GDPR, and various federal and state privacy laws.

Ability to broker complex discussions to achieve the proper balance between business needs and cybersecurity best practices.

Ability to influence others through persuasion to arrive at desired outcomes.

Ability to communicate effectively with a broad range of people and roles, including vendors, information technology professionals, and other business personnel.

Ability and desire to seize the initiative, work proactively, and perform assigned duties in a highly independent manner.

Job#: 3015611

Job Description:

This position will have the responsibility and authority to schedule and dispatch FPL generation resources to economically balance load and generation in order to meet real-time system conditions and to comply with applicable regulatory requirements and NERC reliability standards. This position is also responsible to evaluate and approve OASIS requests and Tags and for performing energy accounting functions. Also, has capability to perform next-day generation planning function and can perform, on a temporary basis, certain system operator functions whenever the on-shift System Operator is away from desk (bathroom breaks, etc.). Responsible for planning, scheduling, and tracking, ensuring compliance with operational and regulatory requirements. Develops work orders, ensures coordination between operations, and leads scheduling processes for maintenance, compliance, and project execution. Evaluates and improves work management execution, participates in event response, and leads root cause analysis for operational efficiency improvements. Coordinates committing, decommitting, and outages of power plants with FPL?s System Operator and PGBU. Ensures rapid recovery from loss of generation to comply with NERC requirements. Performs hourly and on-peak/off-peak energy accounting functions with adjacent balancing authorities.Education: Bachelor's degree in Engineering or professional certification required.Relevant Experience: 6 - 10 years of experience in scheduling, operations, or power system planning.Responsibilities: Develops and maintains work orders, ensuring regulatory compliance and efficient execution. Assists with event response and emergent issues, coordinates scheduling for maintenance, compliance, and project execution. Performs load forecast in order to optimize the FPL generation dispatch mix, ensuring sufficient generation resources are available to meet requirements.Other: Experience in load forecasting, transmission and distribution operations, and real-time system planning; Six Sigma Yellow Belt Certification required.

JOB TITLE: Project/Program Manager II

DURATION: 3 MONTHS

LOCATION: ONSITE IN SUNNYVALE CA

PAY RATE: $47 - $57 HOURLY

Job Description: Join our dynamic B2B operations team managing device logistics across 40+ countries. You'll work with a cross-functional startup-style team handling international shipments from China/Vietnam to APAC, EMEA, and AMEA regions.

Core Responsibilities

- Manage end-to-end forward logistics for internal B2B device orders

- Ensure trade compliance and device certifications across multiple regions

- Coordinate with logistics vendors for timely international deliveries

- Create and maintain tracking systems and performance dashboards

- Handle specialized shipping requirements for battery/non-battery devices

- Utilize AI tools to optimize processes and reporting

Required Qualifications

- Fluent English communication skills

- 5+ years international logistics experience (Asia to global markets)

- Expertise in trade compliance and device certifications

- Proficiency in:

- MS Office Suite (especially Excel)

- Collaboration tools (SharePoint, Confluence, JIRA, Quip)

- AI-powered productivity tools

- Knowledge of battery-based device shipping regulations

- Ability to work on site 5 days a week

- B2B logistics experience

- Amazon device knowledge

- Logistics certifications (CLTD, CTSI)

- Data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau)

- Fast-paced startup atmosphere

- Cross-functional team collaboration

- Flexible schedule requirement

- Limited domestic travel (1-2 trips annually)

How to Apply

Please submit your resume highlighting:

- Relevant logistics experience

- Trade compliance expertise

- Tool proficiency

- Schedule flexibility

Job#: 3016544

Job Description:

Job Description:

Role: Database Administrator

Duration: 12 Months (Contract Role)

Location: Charlotte, NC 28255

Description:

Support multiple Teradata systems including independent marts, development/UAT, disaster recovery, security and the enterprise warehouse systems and business applications.

Building and Installing new Teradata systems including setting access control security layer, DR setup, Manage/Monitor Teradata system performance, including workload management, query performance and tuning, physical node behavior, and amp distribution. Consult on physical database implementations, PPI, skew analysis, join methods, and data access paths. Work with Teradata GSO in resolving RDBMS related incidents.

Implement and administer access policies in conjunction with corporate standards.

Support Mainframe administrative functions, Teradata Data Mover tool support.

Support Unix level process, scripts, and tools for system management and data movement.

Manage, design, support, development and consult on practices of storage management, archive, restore, and disaster recovery.

Familiar with Incident and change management process using tools like Remedy.

Familiar with Cloud computing, Cloud Storage like Native Object Storage, Machine Learning etc.

Advanced working knowledge of Teradata RDBMS at both physical and logical levels.

Advanced working knowledge of Teradata suite of tools; Data Mover, BAR, TASM, TTU Tools, TPT, DBQL, PDCR, Viewpoint.

Familiar with Teradata Systems setup, GDO, DBS Control etc.

Working knowledge of Mainframe interfaces and execution; TDP, JCL, TSO, ISPF, ESCON, FICON, NDM.

Experience with Linux / Unix operating systems.

Automation scripting experience using BASH / Python is a must have for this role.

Teradata security, SSO and Active directory integration. Autosys, Teradata Data Mover, Teradata BAR, TDWM/TASM.

Job#: 3017179

Job Description:

Hardware Design Verification Engineer

Remote

Pay Rate: $84-$86

Be part of a team working on design verification for complex IPs and sub-systems that are a part of modern FPGAs. Develop and execute verification test plans for IPs and/or sub-systems. This includes: development of testbench infrastructure, testcase creation, implementing checkers, writing functional coverage and assertions, develop common/reusable verification components for reuse across teams, perform coverage analysis and closure, run simulations and regressions, triage and debug test failures. Ideal candidate has extensive experience of IP level verification using UVM and System Verilog within the last 3 years. Knowledge of AMBA AXI protocol is preferred, but not required.

Job Responsibilities:

Analyze information for project planning and execution.

Create and modify existing environments and components to verify features in a UVM simulation environment.

Build, test, and modify product prototypes using working models or theoretical models constructed with computer simulation.

Evaluate factors such as reporting formats required, constraints, and need for security restrictions to determine hardware configuration.

Monitor functioning of equipment and make necessary modifications to ensure system operates in conformance with specifications.

Skills:

Creativity, verbal and written communication skills, analytical and problem solving ability.

Team player and detail oriented.

Basic knowledge of Verilog RTL programming language.

Advanced knowledge of UVM and System Verilog programming languages.

Basic knowledge of the practical application of engineering science and technology.

Basic knowledge of ASIC or FPGA based verification.

Previous experience with design related to hardware engineering field.

Education/Experience:

Bachelor's degree in engineering required.

10+ years experience required.

The Creative Audio Data Operations associate will be responsible for maintaining CA data dashboards to assist CA Leadership in driving strategy, performance and impact through key data insights. Job#: 3016132

Job Description:

Job Title: Data Engineer

Job Location: Cincinnati, OH (Onsite)

Job Pay Range: $68/hr-$72/hr

Contract Length: 12 months

About the Role

I'm looking for a Data Engineer to support a Data Science Enablement team focused on powering enterprise ML/AI workflows. This role centers on accelerating the migration of existing R Shiny dashboards to Streamlit, backed by Snowflake, and supporting analytics and risk teams with reliable, production-ready data.

You'll play a key part in transitioning legacy dashboards and data assets to a modern, governed, high-performance environment. The target is to fully retire the legacy platform by the end of 2026, and you'll help drive that transformation by building scalable Streamlit applications and curated datasets that serve data science and credit risk users.

This position is ideal for someone who enjoys moving quickly for users, collaborating with data scientists and ML engineers, and working with modern data tooling. If you've supported model development, reporting, or deployment workflows before - and want to deepen your experience in ML/AI enablement - this role offers strong growth potential.

Job#: 3017096

Job Description:
UI/UX Tableau Designer & Developer

Location: Westlake, TX; Hybrid - 3x onsite

Equipment: All hardware, access badges, and parking provided

Pay: $45-$50/hr; Must be able to work on a W2 without sponsorship

Duration: 12 month contract with potential to go full time
Summary

We are seeking a uniquely skilled UI/UX Designer & Tableau Developer-someone who blends creative design instincts with strong Tableau development capabilities. This role is responsible for designing, building, and enhancing executive-level dashboards that are visually refined, intuitive to use, and technically advanced.

The ideal candidate is a true hybrid: a designer who understands user experience deeply and a developer who can translate that vision directly into production-ready Tableau dashboards. You'll collaborate closely with data engineers, improve existing dashboards, drive UX best practices, and help shape the future of the business's analytics experience.

Adhere to team's governing principles and policies.

Hadoop

Informatica

Teradata



Strong leadership, communication, writing, and relationship skills across varied levels of influence

Excellent analytical and logical skills

Self-starter with thought leadership

Strong knowledge of project life cycle, Data Warehousing, Dimensional Data Modeling

Job Title: Data Center Technical Operations Engineer - Data Center Technical Operations En
Job Description:
Job#: 3017152

Job Description:

JOB TITLE: Data Center Technical Operations Engineer II

DURATION: 6 MONTHS

LOCATION: STERLING, VA ONSITE

PAY RATE: $31 - $42 HOURLY

Job Description: The Data Center Technical Operations Engineer, Facility will be responsible for Data Center Engineering Operations within a Data Center including risk management and mitigation, corrective and preventative maintenance of critical infrastructure, vendor management and metric reporting.

Responsibilities: Responsible for the on-site management of shift technicians, senior shift technicians, sub-contractors and vendors, ensuring that all work performed is in accordance with established practices and procedures. Establish performance benchmarks, conduct analyses, and prepare reports on all aspects of the critical facility operations and maintenance. Work with IT managers and other business leaders to coordinate projects, manage capacity, and optimize plant safety, performance, reliability and efficiency. Operate and manage both routine and emergency services on a variety of critical systems such as: switchgear, generators, UPS systems, power distribution equipment, chillers, cooling towers, computer room air handlers, building monitoring systems, etc. May assist in the design and build out of new facilities. May assist in projects to increase current facility efficiency. Responsible for asset and inventory management. Assist in recruiting efforts Deliver quality service and ensure all customer demands are metBasic Qualifications:

- Bachelor's Degree or Technical (Military/ Trade School) Degree and relevant experience.- 2-4 years of relevant work experience.- 2-4 years of management experience.- Strong verbal and written communication skills.- Strong leadership and organizational skills.- Strong attention to detail.- Ability to prioritize in complex, fast-paced environment.

Preferred Qualifications- 2-4 years of Data Center Engineering Experience- 2-4 years of Data Center Management Experience- Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or relevant discipline.- Fundamental knowledge of network design and layout as well as low voltage (copper/ fiber) cabling

Job#: 3016207

Job Description:

Job Title: Software Development Engineer

Duration: 6 months

Location: Bellevue WA (Remote)

Pay rate: $45.00 - $60.00/hr

Project Summary

We are seeking a Software Development Engineer who will develop automation scripts for Autodesk Revit applications. The job functions entail:

Create Python/C# scripts that seamlessly merge with Autodesk Revit's backend to automate Revit functions

Utilize Python Script node in Dynamo to configure, manage, and perform CRUD operations to create data-driven automation workflows

Modify existing Python scripts to extract data from Revit to connect API's with cost and bill of materials databases

Create logical process maps to convert manual Revit and data input steps into automatic processes through API's

Build test scenario scripts to quality control and acceptance test Autodesk's automation workflows





Map workflows and system logic

Define architecture before coding begins

This phase is critical and experience-heavy



Build APIs that integrate with internal systems

Support automation within Revit

Develop backend services and integrations



Write test code

Ensure outputs match intended logic and workflows



Some automation already exists.

Architecture is still evolving.

Need someone who can:

Help define system architecture

Guide API design decisions before implementation



Bachelor's degree in computer science, Software Engineering or similar engineering degree (mechanical and civil)

5+ years of experience in software development using Python/C#

3+ years of experience with Autodesk Revit API development and customization

3+ years of experience developing commercial software applications

Demonstrated experience with object-oriented programming and software design patterns



Minimum: 3 years of software development experience

Open to candidates with:

Python and/or C#

Years of experience are especially important for architecture and logic mapping, not just coding.

Job#: 3016250

Job Description:

Long Distance (LD) Transport Engineer

1-2 days per week in office required

Location Richardson, TX

MUST HAVE SKILLS (Most Important):

Experience in the telecommunications industry

Technical knowledge of long distance, ultra-long haul and OTN mesh networks

Equipment Knowledge specific to Sonet/SDH, ULH, OTN mesh and WDM transport

Vendor Specific Knowledge: Ciena, Infinera, Fujitsu and varied long haul networks

System Knowledge: BGW or Granite (XNG), CoFEE(Canvas), Nautilus, ICON, CCP, Venue, 3GIS/FIMS

Job requirements specific to engineering and design of ultra-long haul transport

Experience managing complex processes and driving results

Experience with windows-based programs and corporate database systems



Strong understanding of engineering specs and drawings

Knowledge and experience with both equipment inventory and design

Strong working knowledge of the legacy network operating systems

Ability to assess, identify, and mitigate risks that could impact the business or project

Enjoy analyzing problems with autonomy to select and implement right solutions

Work well independently; but also team player able to ensure best outcomes

Manage assignments & competing priorities, staying focused on important deadlines

Experience with windows-based programs and corporate database systems



The Transport Engineer will be responsible for monitoring, planning, implementation, test and turn up of Long Distance (LD) Ultra Long Haul (UHL) transport network.

The engineer will work to define, plan, and engineer LD ULH transport system overbuilds to include fiber acquisition, fiber testing, equipment acquisition, equipment install, system test and turn up. This will include the deployment of fixed grid, flex grid as well as next generation LD ULH transport..



Engineer LD ULH transport builds.

Respond to high failure rate systems outages

Free up space and power in support of network growth

Clear housekeeping order-wire from MDE gear. (Prerequisite to initiating a decommission project and power down of equipment)

Identify directional system/solution for new order-wire/housekeeping.

Monitor and plan LD network utilization and expansion.

Engineer and support site decommissioning work.

Maintain equipment inventory records and LD transport in engineering and provisioning database(s)

Job requirements and responsibilities are specific to engineering and design of ultra-long haul network transport equipment.

Database cleanup to ensure integrity of the system and network

Work w/ peers to ensure on time performance and delivery to support needs of business and customer

Handle escalations and troubleshoot, as needed

Familiarity with field concepts, practices, and procedures

Stay current on technological evolutions.



Bachelor's degree in related technical field or relevant experience

Five or more years of telecom work experience

:

Shift: Standard Day Shift 8a-5p. No weekend work required. No on-call work required.

Job#: 3016262

Job Description:

Job Summary

We are seeking a software developer with strong experience in Java, Spring Boot, Kafka, Spring Security, Kubernetes, and relational databases. The ideal candidate should also have good experience with Angular and TypeScript, and be familiar with Relational or NoSQL databases, Swagger for API documentation, and monitoring tools like Datadog or Splunk. We also seek candidates with working knowledge of CI/CD pipelines, version control, or build tools and experience working in Agile development teams and participating in sprint planning, retrospectives, and code reviews. We're looking for a collaborative problem solver who delivers secure, scalable, and high-quality systems.

The Software Engineer II role reports into the various IT Delivery Hubs at our client. They will work to solve complex business problems through innovative and modern frameworks and technologies with guidance from senior Software Engineers. They will share their r passion for marrying data with emerging technologies to create modern solutions that drive the business forward. They will al so collaborate across business units, technical teams, and the internal and external engineering community to grow themselves through experimentation in new technologies and practices, as well as through guidance and mentorship from senior Software Engineers.



Work within and across Agile teams to design, develop, test, implement, and maintain applications and interfaces across a full stack of technologies, working in conjunction with senior Software Engineers and Architects to execute delivery of availability, resilience, and scalability within solutions

Collaborate with business partners, architecture, infrastructure, and development teams to deliver solutions that drive value

Demonstrate a growth mindset to stay current on the latest technologies, tools, and techniques, bringing in ideas, and taking guidance from senior Software engineers, and participate in internal and external technology communities

Utilize programming languages and technologies like Javascript, Java, Angular, HTML/CSS, TypeScript, and Python, SQL and NoSQL databases, and Container Orchestration services like Kubernetes

Occasional travel may be required based on Business needs





Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field

3+ years of experience in software engineering

1+ year of experience with at least one of the following: JavaScript, Java, API's, Angular, TypeScript, HTML/CSS, .NET, Python



3+ years of experience with at least one of the following: JavaScript, Java, Angular, TypeScript, HTML/CSS, XML, JSON, .NET, Python

2+ years of experience in open-source frameworks (i.e. Spring Boot, Bootstrap, Angular, React, Node.js)

2+ years of experience in Rest API development and technologies (i.e. Confluent Kafka, KSQL, Kong, JSON, Swagger)

1+ years of experience in stateless design and containerization (i.e. Docker, Kubernetes)



2+ years of experience in Relational and NoSQL databases (i.e. SQL Server, Mongo)

Experience with Cloud Platforms such as AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure preferred

Job Title: Data Center Structural Engineer III - Data Center Structural Engineer III
Job Description:
Job#: 3016930

Job Description:

JOB TITLE: Controls MECH BIM Designer II

DURATION: 6 MONTHS

LOCATION: ONSITE IN SEATTLE WA

PAY RATE: $47 - $57 HOURLY

Job Description: Controls ELEC BIM Designer II

Key job responsibilities Daily responsibilities will include utilizing Revit to design the BIM model for Electrical Controls Systems of Data Centers. You must be able to work independently and work within a team environment to accomplish assigned tasks. This includes working with internal groups as well as external suppliers and consultants, manufacturers, vendors, and contractors. Your duties will include:

Be self-motivated and work within the Controls Design, MEP group, as well as within other teams.

Preparing and developing detailed Revit models of Control Systems relating to Electrical building systems.

Developing & publishing construction documentation for Control Systems relating to Electrical designs in a fast-paced environment to meet scheduled deliverables.

Updating and modifying the new Controls models and construction documents as required after first of a kind (FOAK) creation.

Assist with creating and maintaining standard regional BIM templates.

Participate in design coordination meetings with other trades for clash detection and resolution.

Work on concurrent projects in multiple geographical locations.

Assist the project team with information exchange processes between internal and external customers.

Provide coordination support for information requests during construction phases.

Recording and reporting of key metrics to management.

5+ years of design/engineering experience of Controls Electrical building systems for mission critical facilities.

4+ years' experience using Revit for producing engineering BIM models and construction drawings.

Practical knowledge and understanding of Controls, Electrical codes (IPC, or UPC) and safety regulations. This role is Controls focused to create a BIM controls model. The controls scope is closely related to the existing ELEC BIM models but currently the controls content is just an overlay. This role would work directly with the BIM team as the controls POC to create the FOAK controls BIM model.

Job#: 3017041

Job Description:

We are seeking a skilled SuccessFactors Integration Lead to manage end-to-end integrations between SAP SuccessFactors EC, Employee Central Payroll (ECP), and third-party systems. The ideal candidate will have the following:
An understanding of EC and Payroll data models,
Experience supporting seamless data flow, testing, vendor coordination, and issue resolution across HR and Payroll,
Ability to work closely with HR, IT, and external delivey partners to ensure timely and efficient integration design, development, testing, and deployment.


:

Own and deliver integration solutions for SAP SuccessFactors EC, EC Payroll and other modules, including both standard pre-packaged integrations and custom interfaces.

Lead and manage End to End integration lifecycle - from requirement gathering and vendor communication to testing, deployment.

Coordinate closely with third-party vendors to define data requirements, timelines, error handling mechanisms, and SLA expectations.

Analyze business requirements and translate them into scalable technical solutions by developing Functional Design documentations

Own and deliver integration flows between SAP SuccessFactors, Workforce Software, third-party systems (e.g., finance, time tracking, benefits), and on-premise applications.

Perform data mapping, transformation, and validation during integration design.

Collaborate with internal teams and vendors to ensure integrations meet security, compliance, and performance standards.

Lead or support integration testing, troubleshooting, defect resolution, and documentation.

Keep documentation up to date, including integration specs, flow diagrams, error logs.

Conduct unit, system, and end-to-end integration testing with internal teams and third-party vendors.

Collaborate with other SF module leads to identify potential system enhancements and process optimizations.

Be flexible to learn additional SAP SuccessFactors modules and undergo training to enhance consulting expertise.

:

3-6 years of experience in SAP SuccessFactors, specifically in Employee Central and Payroll integration.

Added value will be given to candidates with hands-on experience in SAP Cloud Platform Integration (CPI), Dell Boomi, and Workforce Software modules (e.g., Time, Absence, Scheduling).

Strong understanding of Employee Central data models, EC-Payroll replication, and integration best practices.

Flexibility to learn additional SuccessFactors modules and work with senior consultants for skill development.

Expected to complete projects within specified deadlines

Expected to work occasional weekends, holidays, overtime, or a variety of shifts, when needed, to meet deadlines

Ability and willingness to travel by auto and air as needed to achieve business objectives

Exhibits ability to work both in a team environment and independently

Strong analytical, organization, time management, facilitation, and process management skills

Demonstrated high level of written, verbal and interpersonal skills to communicate technical and non-technical information, ideas, procedures and processes

Able to work in a fast-paced, changing environment, and with all levels of the organization and cope with rapidly changing information

Ability to evaluate and negotiate priorities and adapt to new/evolving individual and team assignments as adjustments are needed.

Knowledge of how current trends and process solutions can address identified business needs and capabilities.

Job#: 3015666

Job Description:

Reason: Replacement

Department: Knowledge Management-Technical Publications Job Category: Product Development Job Title: Technical Writer - CW

Duties: Position: Senior Technical Writer

About Lam Research

Lam Research is a global leader in manufacturing capital equipment used to produce advanced semiconductors. We primarily compete in four key technology areas: deposition, etch, photoresist strip, and single-wafer clean.

About the Customer Support Business Group (CSBG)

CSBG is dedicated to delivering premier customer support throughout the entire lifecycle of Lam's products. Our mission is to drive performance, productivity, safety, and quality for our customers' installed base, while providing service and lifecycle solutions for their most critical equipment and processes.

Role Overview

We are seeking a Senior Technical Writer to join the Knowledge Management / Technical Publications team within CSBG. In this one-year contract role, you will be responsible for creating and editing technical articles and procedures. This position is based in Fremont, California, and involves close collaboration with engineers, core writing staff, and cross-functional teams across Lam's global regions.

Key Responsibilities

Develop and edit clear, accurate, and comprehensive technical articles and procedures for internal and external audiences.

Collaborate with engineers and technical writing teams to finalize technical content using Microsoft Word.

Ensure timely delivery and quality of technical documentation.

Gather information from engineering sources, validate accuracy and completeness, and incorporate it into technical content.

Participate in team meetings, provide status updates, and plan for future deliverables.

Required Qualifications

Education:

Bachelor's degree in Technical Writing, English, Communications, Journalism, or a related field.

Degrees in other disciplines (e.g., Engineering) are acceptable with demonstrated exceptional writing skills.

Experience:

Minimum of 2 years of writing or editing experience (preferred but not required).

Skills:

Strong command of the English language (mandatory).

Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.

Excellent writing and editing skills with strong attention to detail.

Outstanding organizational and communication skills.

Ability to work effectively in a team environment.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with tools such as:

SharePoint

SnagIt or equivalent

Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, FrameMaker, Acrobat DITA XML Content Management Systems (CMS) CorelDRAW WebWorks

Supplier Notes:

Hello Suppliers,

Manager: Nancy Hsieh

Job title: Technical Writer - CW

Max bill rate: (USD)72.50

Number of positions: 1

duration: 12 months

Job description: see information under "Duties" and attachment section Top skills:

Ability to create clear, accurate, and comprehensive technical documentation for diverse audiences.

Strong command of Microsoft Word (mandatory), with familiarity in tools like SharePoint, SnagIt, and CMS as a plus.

Interview process: 2 rounds of interviews: One Virtual then Onsite Remote/ On-Site: Onsite Flexible (Tuesday Mandatory Onsite) Worksite location: 4653 Cushing Parkway, Fremont, CA, 94538, US, USA-CA-05*CA-05
