Job Title: User Experience Designer - User Experience Designer II
Job Description:
Job#: 3017299

Job Description:

JOB TITLE: User Experience Designer II

DURATION: 12 MONTHS

LOCATION: SEATTLE WA - ONSITE

PAY RATE: $38 - $48 HOURLY

Job Description:The Team is looking for a designer to help develop the CX for our flagship IT product, a desktop application that levages a large data set, AI support and proactive notifications to help employees be their productive best.

The product is in its infancy, and will offer opportunities for thinking big, conducting user research and work in collaborative, cross-functional teams.

Responsibilities

Quickly yet thoroughly create process flows, wireframes, and visual design mockups as needed to effectively conceptualize and communicate detailed interaction behaviors.

Work closely with cross-functional teams to help define business and feature requirements via empirical online data, usability findings, market research, and proven UCD principles.

Assess and optimize the performance of new and existing features by actively participating in usability testing and interpreting analytics data using Omniture SiteCatalyst.

Contribute to user interface design and development best practices and standards.

Provide leadership in the area of ecommerce trends, web application design, and user interface innovations.

3-6 years industry experience providing interaction design solutions for web and/or software applications.

Bachelor's or Master's degree in design, human-computer interaction (HCI), or equivalent professional experience.

Fluency in best practices for web-based information architecture and design, as well as strong knowledge of usability principles and techniques

Proficiency with Figma

A strong online portfolio demonstrating past work experience and relevant, user-centered design solutions is required.

Preferred Qualifications:

Excellent communication, presentation, interpersonal and analytical skills including the ability to communicate complex, interactive design concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization.

Self-starter who is a customer-obsessed, detail-oriented, and enthusiastic team player.

Ability to work with highly technical teams and handle multiple projects in an agile, fast-paced environment.

Job Title: Security Engineer IV - Security Engineer IV
Pay: Compensation information provided in the description
Job Description:
Job#: 3016425

Job Description:

Security Engineer IV - Electrical

Location: Seattle, WA (onsite)

Contract Duration: 12 Months

Pay Range: $98-$112 an hour

Job Description:



This Hardware Security Engineering role focuses on verifying and validating security across the entire hardware lifecycle. This role will focus on ensuring that the manufactured hardware meets design specifications and security implementation requirements through systematic evaluation of components and assemblies. Key responsibilities include ensuring that designs are implemented without unauthorized modifications or component substitutions, verifying that all hardware meets established design requirements, and testing hardware to ensure security features are properly enforced. The role also requires reviewing schematics and hardware samples to verify compliance with circuit designs. You will interface with manufacturers and suppliers directly and will review the security compliance evidence that they provide. You will also be responsible for identifying hardware backdoors and attempts to circumvent hardware-based security features. Success in this position requires partnering with multiple stakeholders to accomplish these tasks.



Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical field

5+ years of experience in hardware security, embedded systems security, or similar

Experience designing, testing, and analyzing circuit designs and PCB layouts

Knowledge of threat modeling, secure boot implementations, and cryptography (RSA, AES, HMAC, PQC)

Experience with manufacturing security processes, including secret provisioning and secure production flows

Hands-on experience testing, debugging, or hacking hardware using common electronics test equipment



Master's degree in relevant technical field or equivalent advanced experience

Knowledge of side-channel attack analysis and associated countermeasures

Knowledge of manufacturing processes and procedures, especially automated quality inspection techniques

Experience writing technical documents, project plans and progress reports to leadership and to stakeholders

Knowledge of debug interface security (JTAG, BDM), anti-rollback mechanisms, and fault injection protection

Experience programming in at least one modern language such as C, C++, or Rust

Job#: 3016130

Job Description:

Minecraft Education Data Scientist

We are looking for a Data Scientist with a drive to achieve high impact, high quality results to join the Mojang Player Data and Insights team. In this role, you will be responsible for driving insights that inform the Minecraft Education strategy. You'll partner with product and engineering teams to ensure robust reporting on business metrics, make recommendations to optimize business performance, and evaluate impact of programs and initiatives on key metrics. You will develop and lead analysis that identify key drivers of acquisition, engagement, and retention.



Identify key learnings from analysis and synthesize them into recommendations for stakeholders.

Manage partnerships with Product, Marketing, and other teams to integrate insights into product decisions.

Collaborate with stakeholders to develop analyses that answer the 'why' behind the requests.

Transform complex analyses into compelling, data-driven stories that communicate impact, clarify business trends, and influence strategic decisions across product, marketing, and leadership teams.

Be self-driven and show ability to deliver on ambiguous projects with incomplete or dirty data.

Work with the Engineering team to build and maintain reporting queries for monitoring business health.

Maintain dashboards in PowerBI that enable stakeholders to understand the business and supporting onboarding to other self-service tools

Manipulate and analyze complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources using a variety of tools and data analysis techniques.

7 years experience in data analysis, experience in dashboarding, strong stakeholder management skills. Looking for someone with deep analysis and casual inference skills who is used to working with telemetry data. Experience with advanced ML models is less important than statistical knowledge.



5 years of experience in data analytics.

5 years of experience with SQL, bonus if familiar with SparkSQL, Databricks, or Azure Data Explorer.

2 years of experience with dashboarding tools, PowerBI preferred.

Proficient in Python, bonus if familiar with PySpark.

Able to work in a collaborative, diverse and fast-paced team.

Excellent analytical, and problem-solving skills and autonomy when faced with solving data problems.

Excellent verbal, visual and written communication skills.

Interest in games, bonus if experience in gaming industry.

Local to Seattle area.

Job Title: Engineering and IT Support - Data Center Technician - Technical IT 4
Job Description:
Job#: 3016943

Job Description:

Apex Systems is looking to hire a Data Center Technician for one of our largest clients, if you are interested in applying please send your resume to

Location: PHX - El Mirage or Goodyear Campus

Duration: 6+ months

Shift: B Side Day Shift (Thursday - Saturday and every other Wednesday)

Job Description:

Prepares, stages, sets up, and performs startups and shutdowns (e.g., racks, hard drives, switches) according to specific instructions, checklists, guides, standard protocols, and emails. Performs post-execution quality checks and verifies that grounding, staging, labeling, and cabling are set up properly according to safety protocols, deployment standards, and planned Network Design Tasks (NDTs). Performs diagnostics and troubleshooting following standard procedures, quickly identifies the cause(s) of issues, and replaces faulty components Decommissions hardware for simple changes and refreshes (e.g., memory upgrades, OS rebuilds) following standard procedures with minimal guidance Follows procedures to communicate, report, and escalate incidents to appropriate Datacenter Technician Leads Required: High school diploma, GED, or equivalent Required: Basic knowledge of computer hardware, servers, and components. Required: 1+ year(s) experience supporting IT equipment or related technology. Required: Basic understanding of how to use Microsoft Office applications (Outlook, Excel, Word) Required: Flexibility to work non-standard business hours that may include weekends and/or holidays. Previous datacenter experience a plus

The main function of a Data Center Technician is to monitor software to process business, scientific, engineering, and other data according to operating instructions.



Monitor the system for equipment failure or errors in performance

Respond to program error messages by finding and correcting problems or terminating the program

Help programmers and systems analysts test and debug new programs

Operate spreadsheet programs and other types of software to load and manipulate data and to produce reports



Associate's degree in computer programming or equivalent training required

5+ years experience required

Verbal and written communication skills, problem solving skills, customer service and interpersonal skills

Basic ability to work independently and manage one's time

Job Title: Security Engineer IV - Security Engineer IV
Job Description:
Job#: 3016426

Job Description:

Security Engineer IV -Software

Location: Seattle, WA (onsite)

Contract Duration: 12 Months

Job Description:

We are seeking a Hardware Security Engineer to join our dynamic team focused on device security and hardware validation. This role is essential in ensuring our products meet the highest security standards through comprehensive requirement verification, security assessment, and implementation oversight. You will work at the intersection of hardware design, security engineering, and manufacturing processes to deliver secure, reliable products to millions of customers worldwide.



This Hardware Security Engineering role focuses on verifying and validating security across the entire hardware lifecycle. You will evaluate security features including secure boot implementation, fault injection protection, secure key storage, anti-rollback mechanisms, cryptographic key management, and debug interface restrictions. You will be responsible for performing code reviews and identifying weaknesses and vulnerabilities. You will also interface directly with manufacturers and will work with them to review security requirement compliance evidence and will help them mitigate vulnerabilities. Success in this position requires partnering with multiple stakeholders to accomplish these tasks.



Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical field

5+ years of experience in hardware security, embedded systems security, or similar

Experience programming in at least one modern language such as C, C++, or Rust

Strong knowledge of secure boot implementations, cryptography (RSA, AES, HMAC, PQC), and hardware security architectures (e.g. ARM TrustZone or Intel SGX)

Knowledge of debug interface security (JTAG, BDM), anti-rollback mechanisms, and fault injection protection

Experience writing technical documents, project plans and progress reports to leadership and to stakeholders

Experience with hardware security testing tools and methodologies



Master's degree in relevant technical field or equivalent advanced experience

Experience with DRM implementations and content protection systems

Experience designing or reviewing RTL designs in VHDL or Verilog

Knowledge of side-channel attack analysis and associated countermeasures

Hands-on experience testing, debugging, or hacking hardware using common electronics test equipment

Experience with penetration testing or hacking consumer electronic devices

Experience writing technical documents, project plans and progress reports to leadership and to stakeholders

Experience designing, testing, and analyzing circuit designs and PCB layouts

Job#: 3013028

Job Description:

Job Scope

The QA Engineer is responsible for designing, developing, and executing test plans to ensure the quality and reliability for an enterprise-wide data and automation platform. This role will identify and document defects, collaborate with developers and stakeholders to resolve issues, and contribute to continuous improvement in testing methodologies. The QA Engineer plays a key role in ensuring products meet functional, performance, and security standards before release.

Duties and Responsibilities

Design, develop, and maintain automated test scripts using tools and languages such as Python and JavaScript (Python is required).

Implement automated tests to cover functional, regression, and performance scenarios.

Create and execute E2E test plans and test cases based on requirements and specifications.

Validate software applications against functional and performance expectations.

Identify, document, and track software defects in a bug-tracking system.

Collaborate with developers to ensure timely resolution of issues.

Analyze test results and provide clear, concise quality reports for stakeholders.

Track and report on quality metrics, such as defect density and open defect counts.

Partner with developers, product managers, and other stakeholders to align on quality goals.

Participate in design reviews and requirement analysis meetings to provide QA input.

Recommend and implement improvements to existing testing practices and methodologies.

Stay up to date with QA trends, tools, and best practices.

Maintain accurate and up-to-date testing documentation, including test cases, plans, and scripts.

Perform functional, integration, regression, performance, and security testing.

Use automation to streamline repetitive tasks, especially regression testing.



4+ years of experience in software quality assurance or test automation.

Hands-on experience writing and maintaining automated test scripts with Python.

Exposure to both manual and automated testing across the SDLC.

Experience working in agile development environments with cross-functional teams.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.

Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and agile software development methodologies.



Testing tools & Frameworks: Pytest, Playwright, JMeter.

Programming/scripting: proficiency in Python JavaScript.

Bug tracking and test management: Jira, Qmetry.

CI/CD tools: GitLab.

APIs: Experience with REST API testing using Postman, or similar tools.

Version control: GitLab.

Experience with performance testing and security best practices.

Job#: 3016400

Job Description:

Job Title: Production Support Engineer

Location: Plano TX, Charlotte NC

Duration: 12 Months

Pay rate: $70.00 - $73.68/hr

Description:

Software production Support - Candidate would be responsible for production Support for automation tools focused on Terraform Enterprise. Experience should include Terraform development and administration (back end of platform), System Administration (primarily Linux), integration with other automation tools like Horizon, Ansible Platform and GitHub. Understanding of SDLC processes and tools. Experience with cloud infrastructure as code, API's, YAML, HCL, Python. Role also requires operational experience with monitoring of systems, incidents, and problem management.



Experience on using Terraform.

Review bitbucket feature files, branching strategy, maintain bitbucket branches.

Evaluate services of Azure AWS and use Terraform to develop modules.

Improve and optimize deployment challenges and help in delivering reliable solutions.

Interact with technical leads and architects to discover solutions that help solve challenges faced by Product Engineering teams.

Be part of an enriching team and solve real Production engineering challenges.

Improve knowledge in the areas of DevOps Cloud Engineering by using enterprise tools and contributing to projects success.

Programming or scripting skills in Python/Powershell.

Any related Certification on cloud is nice to have.

Ensure that all system deliverables meet quality objectives in functionality, performance, stability, security accessibility, and data quality.

Provide work breakdown and estimates for tasks on agreed scope and development milestones to meet overall project timelines.

Experience with the Agile/Scrum methodology.

Strong verbal and written communication skills.

Highly detailed oriented.

Self-motivated, with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Strong willingness comfort taking on and challenging development approaches.

Strong analytical and communication skills, ability to effectively work with both technical and non-technical resources.

Must have strong debugging and troubleshooting skills.

Able to implement and maintain Continuous Integration/Delivery (CI/CD) pipelines for the services.

Able to implement and maintain automation required to improve code logistics from development to production.

Assisting the team in instrumenting code for system availability.



GO Language, Terraform Providers Development

Terraform Enterprise Development

Terraform Enterprise Administration/Operations

HashiCorp Configuration Language (HCL)

Infrastructure as Code (IaC)

Cloud Integration (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud Platform)

Linux Administration

Site Reliability Engineering

AWS

Change Management

Horizon Tools (Ansible, Jira, Confluence, BitBucket)

CI/CD Tools (GitHub, Jenkins, Artifactory)

Google Cloud Platform

JIRA

Agile Methodology

Python

Powershell

Job#: 3016626

Job Description:

JOB TITLE: Mechanical Engineer III

DURATION: 3 MONTHS

LOCATION: ONSITE IN WESTBOROUGH, MA

PAY RATE: $42.50 - $52.50

Job Description: Job Title: Mechanical Design Engineer - Manufacturing Test Solutions

Join our dynamic MTAC (Manufacturing Test) team. Collaborate with a cross-functional team of test, process, controls, and design engineers to develop cutting-edge automated and manual test solutions for our diverse robotic systems. Design, prototype, iterate, and deploy solutions that directly enhance the quality, accuracy, and speed of our manufacturing operations. See your solutions make a tangible impact on the business and thrive in our fast-paced, startup-like environment as you shape the future of manufacturing.

Key Responsibilities:

Working collaboratively with multiple stakeholders such as R&D, manufacturing, supply chain, and quality to determine key design considerations for test equipment design, fabrication, and implementation.

Exhibiting role model behavior of thorough engineering analysis and documentation.

Executing projects from a basic concept to production, including developing specifications, design requirements, prototyping, testing, validation, and simplification.

Validating concepts through engineering modeling, hand calculations, and prototypes.

Performing static and dynamic analysis on mechanical systems using both FEA (Ansys or Solidworks Simulation) and hand calculations.

Designing mechanical subsystems with industrial automation systems such as motors, actuators, sensors, safety systems, etc.

Creating design documentation, including requirements, engineering design process, functional specifications, drawings, design validation plans/reports, future iterations, compliance, and preventative maintenance.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent and 5+ years of relevant work experience.

Proven experience in scoping, designing, and analyzing mechanical and electro-mechanical systems.

Strong understanding of Design for Manufacturing and Assembly (DFMA) principles.

Proficiency in SolidWorks. Experience with ProE/Creo for part design, advanced assemblies, configuration management, and drawing creation is a plus.

Hands-on experience with rapid prototyping methods (machining, sheet metal, weldments, and additive manufacturing).

Proficiency with Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) software and change management processes.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience designing and troubleshooting complex mechanical, electro-mechanical, or pneumatic systems.

Excellent technical documentation skills, including creating clear and concise drawings.

Experience with PLM systems (Oracle Agile, PTC Windchill, Solidworks PDM).

Knowledge of volume manufacturing processes.

Flexibility to commute to Westborough, MA, 5 days a week.

Job#: 3016394

Job Description:

Field Technician II

Location: Raleigh, NC

Model: Onsite

*Driving is required - use of your own vehicle will be required. Mileage will be reimbursed at the current Federal rate.

Description:

TOOLS REQUIRED (cordless drill, socket set, safety glasses, gloves, screwdrivers, insulated tool kit and Fluke multimeter)

Responsible for asset management: processes deliveries and replenishes consumables as well as coordinates shipping and receiving of materials. Maintains tools, test sets, and electronic equipment including, but not limited to: fiberoptic transmission equipment, lightwave multiplexing equipment, AC and DC power equipment. Assists in installs, provisions, tests, and maintains DS0 thru OC192 services. May install and test transmission/switching equipment. Troubleshoots network equipment, removes and replaces defective modules, tracks spares and ensures repair. Monitors/locates route and assists in executing restoration in the event of a service interruption, proactively responds to potential problem areas in order to ensure integrity of the network. Responsible for learning all of the systems and applications required to perform the job function adequately. Updates installation records, enters appropriate detailed log information on trouble tickets for reference, and provides reports to others on status updates and issues related to assignments. Performs preventive/scheduled maintenance and inspections on equipment and on the critical infrastructure including, but not limited to: HVAC systems, high-voltage electrical systems, DC Power Plants

Troubleshoots network equipment, removes/replaces defective equipment, and works with appropriate resources to isolate and ultimately restore network. Proactively identify potential problem areas to ensure integrity of the network and company. Assists in the installation/change/decommission and testing of Next Generation technologies such as Edge Compute, Wavelength, Fiber Optic transport, Ethernet, SONET and IP network layers for all available bandwidths offered. May install and test network and customer premise equipment (CPE) including installation and delivery of end user services. Utilizes industry standard software and hardware tools to accurately locate, mark, and protect underground outside plant facilities.AC Power (on limited basis).DC power installs including tertiary and BDCBB.Responsible for asset management processes and replenishment of on-site/truck materials. Coordinates shipping and receiving of company and customer materials. Maintains tools, test sets, and all network equipment. Performs level 1 preventive scheduled maintenance and inspections on network and critical infrastructure equipment including HVAC systems, high-voltage electrical systems, and DC power plants. With the aid of training and coaching, responsible for learning Lumen trouble ticket, provisioning, time tracking, and materials systems and applications required to perform the job function effectively. Update/report inventory records changes, complete transactional updates within systems to show appropriate activities by job type, enter appropriate time log, and responsive to requests for information/escalations. Regularly provides status updates and reports problem situations related to assignments to management. Objectively evaluate, via provided reports/tools, individual performance in respect to area or national performance objectives. With support of manager, ability to identify areas of improvement as applicable. Perform other duties assigned by management team. Understands that basics of installation/change/decommissioning/testing of transport, Ethernet, SONET and IP network layers for all available bandwidths offered.

Job#: 3016429

Job Description:

Supervision - Data Analyst Role

Job Summary

We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Data Analyst to support data governance, quality assurance, and documentation for our supervisory platforms and data migration initiatives. This role plays a critical part in advancing our data strategy and governance framework by delivering actionable insights, ensuring data accuracy, and supporting cross-functional collaboration across business and technology teams.

The Data Analyst will contribute to enterprise-level data alignment, quality testing, and reporting that drive improved decision-making and operational efficiency.

Key Responsibilities

Data Documentation & Governance

Develop and maintain data flow diagrams (DFDs), data scope definitions, and data contracts for supervisory systems and migration projects.

Create and validate source-to-target mappings to align data architecture with enterprise standards.

Data Quality & Testing

Perform User Acceptance Testing (UAT) for data mappings, transformations, and control models.

Design and execute comprehensive test plans and data quality checks to ensure system accuracy and reliability.

Analysis & Reporting

Investigate and resolve data issues, risks, and reporting gaps in collaboration with the Product Owner.

Support implementation and enhancement of supervisory data models based on the product roadmap.

Collaboration & Continuous Improvement

Coordinate with business and technology teams to align on data requirements and deliverables.

Contribute to business-as-usual (BAU) controls and system enhancements to drive ongoing improvements in data integrity.

Qualifications - Required

Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent work experience

3-5+ years of experience in data analysis, data quality/UAT, or data governance within a regulated or complex enterprise environment

Strong proficiency in SQL (SQL Server, Oracle) for data profiling and validation

Hands-on experience with data integration/ETL tools (Informatica, SSIS) and workflow automation (Alteryx)

Experience working with AWS, Snowflake, and data pipeline transformations

Familiarity with Python for data transformation and quality checks

Ability to develop and QA reports/dashboards using Tableau or similar BI tools

Proven experience writing UAT scripts, executing test plans, and documenting defects

Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively across stakeholders

Tools & Technologies

SQL Server, Oracle; Informatica, SSIS; Alteryx; Python; Snowflake; Tableau (or comparable BI tools).

Qualifications - Preferred

Experience in supervision/compliance data domains or financial services settings.

Background with systems of record (SOR), Mantas, or similar surveillance/compliance platforms.

Knowledge of data governance frameworks and control model validation practices.

Familiarity with Jira or similar tools for defect tracking and UAT coordination.

Job#: 3016706

Job Description:

Job Title: Project Manager

Duration: 12 Months Contract Role

Location: Jacksonville, FL (Hybrid 3 days Onsite)

Summary

Position Summary: Serves as the single point of accountability for end-to-end Project execution across People, Process, and Technology dimensions (Projects may range from $1MM-$5MM depending on size and complexity). Owns Project Governance including Forecasting and Financials, managing a large Project Budget across multiple Service Provider Teams; ensures on-budget performance (+/- 1%). Leads Project Work Group Meetings and owns regular Status Communications to Stakeholders; will interact with a wide variety of Stakeholders including Senior Business Partners. Ensures all Project Deliverables are managed on time and with high quality. Owns all Project System of Record Updates and team adherence to Enterprise Change Standards. Keeps Project Team focused on delivering Critical Requirements (Minimum Viable Product) and Scope; escalates items that are Change Controls and/or should be deferred to later phases of work. Escalates and drives resolution of key Project Risks to ensure Projects meet their intended objectives and deliver on time. Applies proactive upfront Planning to drive predictable Project Execution with no major surprises or unexpected headwinds. Ensures all Project Objectives are successfully achieved with appropriate Measurement and Traceability in place to confirm. Strong understanding of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).

Agile Tools (Jira)

Data Governance Protection & Data Management

Proven track record as an experienced Project Manager directly managing the delivery of Solutions. Experience driving End-to-End delivery across large and complex Project efforts ensuring all People, Process, and Technology Deliverables are managed on time and with high quality. Ability to manage Project Budget and Financials (Project Budgets typically range from $1MM-$5MM); Resource will own monthly Project Forecasting Deliverables. Experience providing Project Updates and leading discussions with Senior Technology and LOB Partners; demonstrates ability to communicate and adjust level of detail and messaging based on Audience. Demonstrates strong competence with core Project Management Tools and Processes used within Global Technology, specifically around Enterprise Change Management requirements (this Role will own all Governance and Updates across Project Execution and Financials). Self-Starter, requiring minimal direction and takes ownership of the assignment and drives it to completion, while also partnering with Resources in a Matrixed Environment.

Proven track record as a capable Project Manager. Experience leading Agile, Waterfall, and Hybrid Projects. Experience with delivering Global Technology Initiatives. PMP Certification.

Job#: 2091755

Job Description:

Oracle Cloud Engineer

Apex Systems, the nation's 2nd largest Information Technology staffing firm, is looking for an Oracle Cloud Engineerwho excels in their role and are committed to delivering an exceptional experience for our client's internal and external end users and clients. We look for individuals who are passionate in life and bring those qualities to work every day. Do you instill confidence, trust, and respect, encourage success and build relationships? We are looking for people like this to join our friendly, engaged, professional team.

Please send your resume to Michelle Pavese at

Role: Oracle Cloud Engineer

Duration: year contract with extension or possible perm conversion

Location: Remote

Details:



1. Oracle Cloud

3. Systems Engineering in background to some degree

4. Basic scripting (open to languages whether PowerShell, python, ansible)



1. Kubernetes or Docker

2. Security cert

TopBuild is seeking a Senior Cloud Engineer to lead the design, optimization, and governance of our hybrid cloud environment, balancing cloud capabilities with on-premises infrastructure. This role will focus on delivering secure, efficient, and scalable architectures in Oracle Cloud, while ensuring seamless integration with existing enterprise systems. The Senior Cloud Engineer will provide both technical leadership and strategic insight, driving adoption of best practices, establishing governance frameworks, and enabling modern capabilities such as automation, DevOps, and containerization. This individual will act as a trusted advisor within the IT Infrastructure team, partnering with leadership on strategic initiatives while also delivering hands-on engineering expertise and mentoring junior staff.

Design and lead implementation of secure, scalable hybrid cloud architectures leveraging Oracle Cloud, and on-premises systems.

o Establish and enforce governance, security, and compliance frameworks across cloud and hybrid environments.

o Define strategies for hybrid adoption, ensuring workloads are deployed in the right environment based on business and technical requirements.

o Research emerging technologies and recommend adoption to improve agility, efficiency, and security.

o Serve as a subject matter expert in strategic committees and advise leadership on cloud direction.

o Partner with IT teams and business stakeholders to align hybrid-cloud strategies with organizational goals.

o Lead deployment of hybrid workloads and ensure secure integration with on-premises systems.

o Implement cloud services using Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, Bicep, ARM templates).

o Provide technical leadership in migrations and modernizations, balancing innovation with operational stability.

o Guide adoption of container platforms (Kubernetes, Docker) and DevOps practices as the organization evolves.

o Collaborate with vendors and partners to evaluate cloud and infrastructure solutions.

Job#: 3016925

Job Description:

Job Title: Data Analyst III

Duration: 12 Months

Location: Chicago IL (5 Onsite a week)

Pay rate: $45.00 - 50.17/hr

Job Overview

We are seeking an experienced Data Governance Analyst to support enterprise-level and local data management requirements on a ServiceNow implementation initiative. This role will work closely with data architecture, engineering, and quality teams, as well as data consumers using Global Information Security data, to ensure compliance with Enterprise Data Management policies and GIS data governance requirements.



Facilitate governance routines, meetings, and detailed deliverable tracking.

Provide governance oversight for critical data use in applications, metrics, and reporting.

Conduct technical analysis to validate data use requests and business requirements.

Collaborate with data owners to identify and document business and technical metadata.

Maintain data dictionaries, catalogues, lineage, and metadata within the metadata repository.

Ensure quality and integrity of metadata and escalate issues as needed.

Design process flows and diagrams using Visio.

Risk identification, management, and escalation.

Assess and manage data-related risks in alignment with financial institution standards.

Apply understanding of data risk principles as defined by Enterprise Data Management Policy to ensure compliance and mitigate exposure.



10+ years in roles requiring critical thinking and problem-solving.

5+ years in technical and analytical roles (non-development).

5+ years in data governance and/or metadata management.



Demonstrated proficiency in data management principles.

Experience in managing Critical Data Elements and ensuring accurate provisioning from authoritative sources.

Proven experience collaborating with data consumers to capture use cases and business requirements.

Experience in aligning business data needs with accurate, fit-for-purpose data sources.

Experience with metadata management tools and enterprise data catalog solutions.

Ability to establish and maintain data lineage frameworks for traceability.

Demonstrated proficiency in managing business and technical metadata.

Proven ability in managing data governance processes, routines, and deliverables.

Understanding risk management and regulatory compliance within financial institutions.



Prior experience collaborating with internal audit and regulatory teams.

Proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint.

Experience with JIRA for managing governance tasks in Agile environments.

Data Management industry certification (e.g. Certified Data Management Professional)



Self-driven, motivated, and quick to learn.

Ability to prioritize and work with minimal oversight.

Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.

Proven interpersonal skills to gain cooperation from stakeholders.

Highly organized with strong attention to detail.

Job#: 3015178

Job Description:

Apex Systems, a World-Class Technology Solutions Provider, is seeking applicants for the below position on behalf of our client. Please apply if interested and qualified. Please note that only qualified candidates will be contacted.

Position: Business Systems Analyst - Murex SME

Project: Murex implementation

Location: Preferred North Carolina | Open to full remote

3-6 month contract to FTE (originally opened as FTE role)

W2 contract, paid hourly. No C2C, 1099, or third-party submissions will be accepted. Only direct W-2 candidates will be considered.

W2 $70-80/hr, negotiable based on experience

Banking



This position delivers strategic insight into business systems through complex analysis, reporting, and operational activities. Serves as a technical expert on system usage and performance. Determines business requirements and implements appropriate specifications, monitoring for compliance and effectiveness. Assists in identifying and resolving process issues which may involve system testing or development. May oversee the work of less experienced analysts in the work group.

This role will interface with business, other application development teams within IT as well as various shared services organizations and infrastructure areas. Resource will be part of Treasury IT, supporting continued build out of Treasury investments, capital markets, cash, and liquidity management capabilities at First Citizens Bank.







Bachelor's Degree and 4 years of experience in Systems Support, or Analytics, or Operations Support OR High School Diploma or GED and 8 years of experience in Systems Support, or Analytics, or Operations Support

Job#: 3016500

Job Description:

Job Title: QA Consultant II

Location: Charlotte, NC

Duration: 12 Months

Pay rate: $50.00 - $51.08/hr

Job Description

This role brings a 'Quality Assurance (QA) mindset' to the team, and will work directly with QA managers across all domains to manage and oversee testing engagement and support all aspects of the testing lifecycle. The "Test Lead" will be expected to work closely with all QA managers to track initiatives and assign resources from both offshore and onshore teams. The "Test Lead" will work side by side with development and business partners to determine optimal test coverage and ensure high quality and defect free software is delivered to our customers. They will be accountable and responsible for ensuring that test planning, test execution and defect management for a variety of projects across multiple lines of business and technology platforms are delivered and executed flawlessly. The "Test Lead" is expected to be the 'subject matter expert' for the business and technical components of an application. The "Test Lead" will review testing artifacts and all required testing activities to ensure adherence to existing testing standards.



Automation Testing



Soap/Rest Webservices



Python



At least 5+ year of experience with Back-end systems/ETL Automation/Hadoop Testing/Kafka KStream/API Automation Testing.

Strong experience with building Test Plans, Test Scripts, using any Test case Management Tool Octane/ALM/qTest

Strong knowledge of SQL with some knowledge of Python Scripting.

Strong knowledge of API Testing

Ability to lead test planning for complex features that span across the platform or multiple teams.

Ability to create and optimize test processes including defect management and reporting.

Ability to create Test Automation Frameworks using any tool UFT/TOSCA/Selenium/SOA Test.

Knowledge of various CI/CD tools such as JIRA, Bitbucket, GIT, Jenkins and Ansible.

Familiar with Agile Process



Participate in triaging reported issues/defects for automated solutions and assist with resolving or escalating them as necessary.

Manage test execution and assist with resolving, communicating or escalating any issues that may result in test plan variance.

Contribute to test data management approach, processes and tools.

Coordinate Conditioning of and generation of test data and ensure data compliance requirements are met on all levels of test environments. Assist in identifying and managing sensitive test data.

Participate in triaging reported issues/defects and assist with resolving or escalating them as necessary.

Create and manage traceability. Trace tests forwards/backwards through the development lifecycle and back to requirements.

Ensure alignment and sign off for test cases from business and other stakeholders.

Optimizing test suites employing techniques such risk-based testing.



Webservices Testing experience, REST APIs and 1H Testing Experience

Knowledge of various CI/CD tools such as JIRA, Bitbucket, GIT, Jenkins and Ansible.

Prior working experience on implementing automation framework using UFT/Selenium/TOSCA/SOA Test.

Position Description:

We are seeking a visionary and highly technical PLM Architect to lead the design, development, and implementation of our 3DEXPERIENCE (3DX) platform ecosystem. $75-80/hr

Job#: 3016890

Job Description:

Job Title: Production Support Engineer

Location: Plano TX (onsite 3 Days a week)

Duration: 12 Months

Pay rate: $70.00 - 73.68/hr

Roles and Responsibilities:

Provide end-to-end support of production applications, ensuring their stability, reliability, and performance.

Conduct in-depth problem analysis of application, troubleshoot system errors, and performance issues.

Perform proactive application stability analysis to investigate performance concerns, system errors and improvement opportunities.

Take ownership of problem root cause analysis and implement appropriate remediation.

Lead chronic issue investigations to minimize business impact and maintain system health.

Drive proactive monitoring review and implementation strategies.

Collaborate with Engineering, Application Development, and Infrastructure teams to implement break fixes, code updates, configuration changes, and production enhancements.

Handle application management, business continuity, server patching coordination, vulnerabilities remediation, Splunk monitor setup.

Lead production incident triaging calls.

Provide production on-call support, including weekend rotation on a round-robin basis.

Execute disaster recovery procedures and strategies.

Respond to and resolve production tickets promptly to meet SLA requirements.

Hands-on experience with Red Hat Ansible Automation Platform, JFROG Artifactory, XLRelease, Cloudbees Jenkins, Bitbucket or similar version control tool.

Expertise in Unix systems.

Experience in artifact repositories, dependency management and compliance engines to scan artifacts in Artifactory for vulnerabilities and policy violations.

Strong experience in OpenShift containers, Apache Kafka.

Strong understanding of CICD pipeline.

Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python or Bash for automation.

Experience with monitoring tools like Dynatrace and Splunk to maintain platform reliability.

Demonstrated ability to contribute to automation efforts for improved operational efficiency.



Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information technology, or a related field.

Proven experience in a production support or similar role, preferably in a CICD Platform environment.

Availability for on-call support, including weekend rotations, on a round-robin basis.

7+ years of experience in production operations.

Excellent communication and collaboration skills for effective work across cross-functional teams.

Familiarity with database platforms such as Oracle or PostgreSQL.

Knowledge of F5 Load balancer, GTM, high availability architectures and disaster recovery strategies.

Certification in Red Hat Linux, DevOps methodologies or related fields.

Job#: 3016979

Job Description:

Apex Systems is actively hiring for a Wind Turbine Contract Coordinator role with a Fortune 200 Renewable Energy Client!

This position is designated as remote with 90% travel

**For immediate consideration, please send your most up-to-date resume in a Word Document to: Andrew at

Position: Wind Turbine Contract Coordinator

90% travel (Regionally)

This contractor will be overseeing wind turbine overhauls and maintenance.

2+ years of relatable professional experience in engineering, consulting, or project management preferred.

M-F, 40 hours per week. Possibility of OT with permission.

12 month contract + potential extension or conversion



Under limited guidance, position interacts with a team of maintenance specialists, technicians, engineers, and contractors involved in wind turbine overhauls and maintenance. Position is involved with internal and external resources to execute maintenance work with direct accountability for safety, environment, quality, schedule, and cost. Position is expected to apply rigor, discipline, and focus in following standardized processes and procedures, while continuously applying a lean and quality improvement mindset to improve the process. Position should possess technical knowledge of wind turbine equipment and be skilled in understanding and resolving technical issues, including for unplanned scope. Position works closely with other Specialist, Supervisors and Contract Coordinators to develop and implement complex plans for execution of work scope.

This position requires extensive travel nationwide across the wind fleet to support plant outages (90% travel).



Employees in this job direct a team of maintenance specialists, technicians, engineers, and contractors involved in major maintenance activities or plant maintenance. Individuals in this position lead internal and external resources to Deliver Certainty for assigned major maintenance activities or plant maintenance to achieve objectives for: safety, environmental, quality, schedule, and cost compliance.

Job#: 3016948

Job Description:

Apex Systems is hiring for an Sr. Production Control Engineer (3rd shift) for a major Healthcare company.

12-month contract with possibility to extend or convert.

FULLY remote anywhere in the US.

Must be able to work 1030P to 830A CST; this role is 4x10 hour shifts - Sun/Mon/Tues/Wed.





This role is responsible for performing continuous (24x7) monitoring of the client's application and infrastructure environment to ensure system stability and availability.

The individual in this position will lead a team of monitoring analysts and act as a key point of contact during incidents and outages.

The selected candidate will serve in a dual-capacity role-acting as both a technical resource and a shift lead, providing guidance, oversight, and technical support to an offshore monitoring team.

Team of 6-8 offshore vendor resources who perform monitoring and alert response duties during their daytime shift (aligned with the U.S. overnight hours).

The offshore team is experienced and capable of executing assigned tasks but requires direction, oversight, and escalation support from this position.

Acts as the primary U.S.-based point of contact for overnight monitoring operations, ensuring processes are followed and incidents are managed effectively.









Experience with enterprise monitoring platforms:

o Dynatrace

o SolarWinds

o Splunk

Incident Detection, Response & Management:

o Expertise in incident triage, prioritization, and escalation.

o Familiarity with ITIL-based processes and Major Incident Management best practices.

ITSM Tools & Process Execution:

o Experience working with ticketing and workflow in Service now.

o Understanding of change and problem management processes.



Communication skills (verbal and written)

Team Player that is accountable, leads by example

Detail oriented

Critical thinker



Oversee and guide a team of 6 - 8 monitoring contractors, ensuring all activities follow established processes and procedures.

Monitor application and infrastructure systems using enterprise tools to detect and respond to alerts in real time.

Perform initial triage and investigation of alerts to determine root causes and escalate appropriately.

Participate in and potentially lead Major Incident Calls, coordinating with technical teams to resolve issues efficiently.

Communicate effectively with senior leadership and stakeholders regarding incident impact, user disruption, and resolution progress.

The Opportunity

Job#: 3016773

Job Description:

JOB TITLE: Agile Release Train Engineer / ART Lead

INTERVIEW PROCESS: One panel interview (video) and one final call with skip-level if deemed necessary.

SCHEDULE: Hybrid, minimum of 3 days per week

LOCATION: Charlotte, NC

POSITION SUMMARY:

This role is responsible for optimizing the flow of epics/features and the value delivered by a smaller Agile Release Train (ART). Focused on serving the needs of the train to drive performance and growth. Key responsibilities include coordinating and facilitating ART ceremonies, managing dependencies across teams in the ART, and providing visibility into the health of epic/feature delivery and the overall program increment. This role ensures impediments to epic/feature delivery are resolved quickly and protects the teams from outside disruptions to delivery.







Guide and coach the teams on the Agile Release Train on Scrum practices and develop their understanding of Agile principles.

Help define norms/agreements for the ART and enforce the agreements.

Coordinate and facilitate ART ceremonies (Backlog Refinement, Program Increment (PI) Planning, ART Sync or PO Sync, Scrum of Scrums, System Demos, Retrospective).

Collaborate with the Product Manager to ensure the program has a healthy product/program backlog.

Facilitate dependency management, risk management, and impediment removal for the ART.

Promote and facilitate communication and collaboration within the ART to support value delivery and PI commitments.

Provide status updates and reporting pertaining to ART plans, delivery, timelines, and impediments to stakeholders and leadership.

Ensure Enterprise Change Management and other policy requirements for technology solutions are met for the epics/features delivered by the ART.

Measure ART delivery, maturity, and performance and review metrics with the ART to identify improvement opportunities.

Capture data to help determine/track product funding and resource acquisition needs.

Mentor Scrum Masters.



SAFe Certification (RTE, SCP, SSM, or POPM)



PI Planning facilitation

Effective stakeholder management

Proficiency in Atlassian Tools (Jira, Confluence) and Horizon CI/CD Tools



Risk, Issue, and Dependency Management

Promote engineering fundamentals - design, quality, testing, and technical debt visibility

Familiarity/Experience with MRA process preferred

Experience with Change Governance process

Clear, audience-appropriate communication



Host quarterly PI planning and ensure readiness

Maintain backlog health and adherence to Enterprise Change Management standards

Own end-to-end delivery execution of epics and capabilities across multiple ARTs and teams

Drive predictable delivery through flow metrics, capacity planning, dependency mapping, and risk management

Evaluate team metrics, goals, and performance

Coach Scrum Masters on Agile delivery, executive-level reporting, and communication

Expert-level Agile knowledge, including dashboards, roadmaps, Jira usage, and dependency management

Operate with a mindset of continuous improvement and operational excellence

Job Title: Product Design and Development - Materials Development 2
Job Description:
Job#: 3017314

Job Description:

Job Title: Textile Developer II

Location: Beaverton, OR(hybrid)

Contract: 6 months

Rate: $28 to $32/hour

Our client does more than outfit the world's best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At Nike, it's about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR

We're looking for an innovative and curious Material Developer with a passion for textiles, print and pattern. The candidate will use their technical materials knowledge, critical thinking and collaborative skills to deliver creative material solutions for our performance and lifestyle Apparel product. Strong skills in textile and print development as well as an understanding of the product creation process will ensure delivery of exceptional product for our athletes*!

WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON

If this is you, you will explore ideas in textiles and print/pattern from trend through technological advancements. This research will enable the collaboration with our product creation team partners to deliver on the highest level of athlete* experience with a commercialized materials palette grounded in our key sustainability goals. You will drive seasonal material development in partnership with vendors and manufacturing teams from concept to commercialization. This includes requesting testing, tracking and creative material solutions.

WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH

This is the Nike matrix: You will report into the Global Apparel Materials Team (GLAM) and support our partners within Apparel including key collaborations with Innovation, Design, Product Merchandising, Technical Development, Sourcing and Manufacturing. You will need to work effectively within the materials team to ensure a thoughtful approach to developing new materials and maintain an understanding of how materials perform when in garment form.

WHAT YOU BRING

Bachelor's degree in a Textile Science, Apparel or a combination of relevant education, experience, and training

Minimum of 1 year experience of an apparel product creation role or similar industry experience

Technical materials knowledge, including yarns, knitting, weaving, dyeing, printing and finishing techniques

Knowledge of knits, wovens, ribs and print

Experience partnering with vendor to develop and test a material from inception to production

Strong verbal and written communications skills

Digital literacy, including Microsoft office software and Product Data Management

Experience managing multiple projects with competing resources and deadlines across multiple seasons

Strong information seeking-skills and a drive to make things happen

Ability to work independently and cooperatively in a diverse group

Ability to network and apply internal and external resources

Experience working with performance materials is highly desired

Knowledge of industry material trends

Ability to travel up to approximately 10% of the time

Job#: 3016528

Job Description:

IBM DB2 Warehouse Administrator (AWS Data Warehouse)

Job Summary

Apex Systems is seeking a DB2 Warehouse Administrator to support the implementation, migration, and ongoing operations of our client's enterprise Data Warehouse, migrating from existing vendor-hosted AWS to client-hosted AWS infrastructure.

This role will play a critical part in the migration from vendor-hosted to client-hosted AWS environment, initial configuration, and ongoing administration of IBM DB2 Warehouse, support data migration activities from vendor-hosted to client-hosted AWS infrastructure, collaborate closely with ETL and DataStage teams, and ensure the performance optimization, security, reliability, and ongoing maintenance operations after the migration of the Data Warehouse platform. The ideal candidate will have strong hands-on DBA experience in DB2 Warehouse, familiarity with cloud-based environments, and a solid understanding of healthcare or Medicaid data.





Install, configure, and administer IBM DB2 Warehouse in an AWS environment

Perform database provisioning, patching, upgrades, and configuration management

Monitor database health, availability, and capacity; proactively address performance issues

Implement and maintain backup, recovery, and disaster recovery strategies

Manage database security, user access, roles, and privileges in alignment with State security policies

Support audit, logging, and compliance requirements applicable to State and Federal systems



Support initial data migration from vendor-hosted AWS to state-hosted AWS into DB2 Warehouse from legacy or source systems

Validate data loads, data integrity, and migration outcomes

Partner with vendors and internal teams during migration and cutover activities

Assist in defining data standards, naming conventions, and warehouse best practices



Work closely with IBM DataStage, IBM Cognos, and ETL

Optimize SQL, indexing, partitioning, and workload management

Tune batch loads, incremental loads, and reporting queries

Identify and resolve ETL-related performance bottlenecks

Provide guidance on DB2 best practices for large-scale analytical workloads



Provide ongoing database operations and maintenance support

Respond to incidents, perform root cause analysis, and implement corrective actions

Participate in change management, release planning, and operational readiness activities

Create and maintain DBA runbooks, standard operating procedures, and technical documentation

Support production and non-production environments.



Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field (or equivalent experience)

8+ years of experience as a Database Administrator supporting DB2 or 3+ years of experience for DB2 Warehouse edition.

Hands-on experience administering databases in a cloud environment (AWS preferred)

Strong SQL skills and experience with performance tuning and query optimization

Experience supporting enterprise data warehouse or analytical database platforms

Familiarity with backup, recovery, high availability, and disaster recovery strategies

Experience working in a regulated or public-sector environment is a plus



Experience with IBM DB2 Warehouse on AWS

Hands-on experience working with IBM DataStage and IBM Cognos for ETL and Cognos reporting workloads

Knowledge of Medicaid, healthcare claims, eligibility, provider, or encounter data

Familiarity with HIPAA, CMS, or State/Federal data governance and security requirements

Experience supporting large-scale batch processing and reporting workloads

AWS experience with services such as EC2, S3, IAM, CloudWatch, and networking concepts

Job#: 3016277

Job Description:

Job Title: Lead Agilist

Job Location: Cincinnati, OH (Onsite)

Job Pay Range: $70/hr-$75/hr

Contract Length: 12 Months

The Lead Agilist is an experienced practitioner with a minimum of five years of full-time business experience and at least three years of hands-on Scrum experience. After completing organizational training in Agile and Scrum practices, the Lead Agilist is assigned one or more Agile squads to support.

This role is responsible for ensuring that Agile squads understand and apply Agile values, Scrum principles, and effective delivery practices. Lead Agilists use strong observational and coaching skills to identify team needs and intervene appropriately. They promote the growth and development of every team member, using thoughtful communication and powerful questioning techniques to encourage creative problem-solving.

Lead Agilists model servant leadership and foster an environment of trust, collaboration, and continuous improvement. They guide teams in applying the Scrum framework, facilitate Scrum events as needed, and ensure these events deliver meaningful value. They coach Product Owners and Development Teams on effective backlog management, shared understanding of goals, and alignment on success criteria.

Additionally, Lead Agilists support teams in developing self-organization, cross-functional collaboration, risk identification, dependency management, conflict resolution, and craftsmanship. They encourage teams to solve problems independently while maintaining an Agile mindset. They also coach stakeholders across the organization on Agile practices and the impact of their interactions with Agile teams.

A successful Lead Agilist embraces a learning mindset and helps teams continuously improve through inspect-and-adapt practices, leveraging feedback loops, metrics, and other information radiators. They identify opportunities for improvement beyond standard Scrum ceremonies by applying foundational knowledge of DevOps, automation, testing frameworks, and other Agile methodologies. They model openness, courage, collaboration, and continuous learning.

Lead Agilists and their squads share responsibility for identifying and communicating risks, adhering to organizational policies, and ensuring actions support a positive customer experience. They consistently identify, assess, manage, and monitor risks while maintaining alignment with organizational expectations.

Job Title: Product Design and Development - Product Development Engineer 3
Job Description:
Job#: 3016661

Job Description:

Title: LEAD TECHNICAL DESIGNER

Contract - 3 months + extension

Location: Beaverton, OR (onsite)

Rate: $50 to $55/hour

NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world's best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At Nike, it's about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.



The Studio Lead Technical Designer is someone who's is a patternmaker and sewing expert. This individual is pro-active, collaborative, safety minded, detailed oriented, and comfortable trouble shooting, sharing expertise in patternmaking, garment construction and studio equipment. They participate in apparel development process with the Nike Product Creation teams. We need someone who can be agile and work in a fluid creative environment as well as travel for fast pace projects as needed.

The Lead Technical Designer/Studio Lead keeps abreast of market trends, team goals, new technologies and consumer needs throughout the development process and engages appropriately to ensure projects are completed within corporate guidelines and goals for all facets of product creation.



The Lead Technical Designer will be responsible for patterning, sample making and fit execution of studio supported projects. They will identify and address key opportunities in pattern/construction/manufacturing and plan accordingly to deliver against the project brief. You will track and facilitate project review meetings in partnership with OSS leadership.

They will also be responsible for providing expertise through developing and leading studio-based trainings and help support events happening within the Apparel Maker Space, Olive St Studio. You will participate in planning, maintaining studio inventories, assets and assist in equipment use and upkeep.



You will report to the Senior Manager of Olive St Studio.

The Lead Technical Designer will collaborate with Design, Product Management, PCC, materials and manufacturing to effectively execute on product development & fit goals deliverables.



Ability to travel up to 10% of the time (domestic and international)

Job#: 3017211

Job Description:

Automation Architect

As an Automation Architect, you will design, build, and scale modern, intelligent end-to-end automation frameworks that ensure high release confidence across all product lines, with a strong focus on Angular-based web applications. This role requires deep hands-on expertise in Playwright (TypeScript) and mandatory experience using AI to create, maintain, and stabilize automated tests.

You will be responsible for architecting highly scalable automation solutions that support parallel and sharded execution, seamless CI/CD integration via GitHub Actions, and cloud-based execution using BrowserStack. A core focus of this role is leveraging AI-driven automation techniques to reduce flakiness, accelerate test creation, optimize execution, and deliver actionable quality insights, particularly in complex, dynamic Angular UIs.

This is a hands-on role where you will drive framework evolution, define best practices, and champion the adoption of intelligent, self-healing automation across the organization.

Key Responsibilities

Automation Framework & Engineering

Design, implement, and maintain a Playwright (TypeScript) automation framework focused on scalability, maintainability, and reliability for Angular applications.

Build reusable utilities, fixtures, and test patterns aligned with Angular architecture, including component-based UIs, routing, and asynchronous rendering.

Address Angular-specific automation challenges such as change detection, dynamic DOM updates, async operations, and test synchronization.

Ensure cross-browser, cross-device, and cross-OS test coverage.

AI-Driven Automation (Mandatory)

Use AI to create automated tests, accelerating UI, API, and end-to-end test development for Angular workflows.

Apply AI-based self-healing mechanisms to automatically adapt to frequent Angular UI, DOM, and locator changes.

Identify, analyze, and fix flaky tests using AI, including issues related to timing, synchronization, change detection, and environment instability.

Leverage AI-assisted failure analysis to cluster failures and highlight root causes.

Implement intelligent test selection and prioritization to reduce unnecessary CI/CD execution.

Continuously improve test stability, accuracy, and execution performance using AI-driven insights.

CI/CD & Cloud Execution

Build, configure, and maintain CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions for automated test execution.

Enable parallel execution and test sharding to improve feedback cycles.

Integrate and manage BrowserStack or similar cloud testing platforms for scalable, distributed execution across browsers and devices.

Test Coverage & Quality Engineering

Expand and maintain automation coverage across Angular UI, REST APIs, and accessibility (WCAG/A11Y).

Collaborate with engineering and QA teams to align automation with Angular product workflows and risk areas.

Perform exploratory or manual testing when needed to better understand complex Angular user flows and edge cases.

Reporting & Observability

Generate and analyze automation test reports to identify failures, flakiness, and trends.

Integrate test results with observability and monitoring tools to correlate failures with system health.

Use data and insights to continuously improve automation reliability and effectiveness.

Required Qualifications

Core Requirements

Bachelor?s degree in Computer Science or 8+ years of equivalent experience in test automation and framework design.

Strong hands-on experience with Playwright (TypeScript).

Strong experience testing Angular applications, including understanding of component lifecycles, routing, and async behavior.

Mandatory hands-on experience using AI in automation testing, specifically for:

Test creation and maintenance

Self-healing automation

Flaky test detection and automated stabilization

AI-assisted failure analysis

Strong understanding of HTML5, CSS3, modern JavaScript/TypeScript, and browser behavior.

Proven experience building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines, especially with GitHub Actions.

Hands-on experience with BrowserStack or similar cloud device farms.

Solid understanding of RESTful APIs, async programming, and microservices-based systems.

Experience with test management tools (e.g., Tricentis, TestRail, Xray).

Working knowledge of observability tools (e.g., Datadog, New Relic).

Experience with accessibility testing using tools such as Axe or Evinced.

Nice to Have

Experience with Angular Material, NgRx, or other Angular ecosystem libraries.

Exposure to AWS or other cloud platforms.

Familiarity with performance or security testing.

Experience integrating or evaluating commercial or open-source AI testing tools.

What You?ll Need to Succeed

Strong hands-on coding and debugging skills in TypeScript and JavaScript.

Proven ability to design and maintain scalable automation frameworks for Angular applications.

Practical experience using AI to reduce flakiness and automation maintenance overhead.

Deep understanding of web fundamentals - DOM structure, selectors, async behavior, and accessibility.

Ability to work independently while collaborating closely with cross-functional teams.

A quality-first mindset with a focus on reliability, efficiency, and continuous improvement.

Curiosity and willingness to adopt AI-driven approaches to modern test automation.

Job#: 3016542

Job Description:

Site: Headquarters (HDQ)

Business Unit: Digital Execution Mobile

Description: Hybrid - Open to all location (HDQ - Vienna, VA, WCC - Winchester, GPO - Pensacola, FL, San Diego)

Description

To support the development, maintenance, and enhancement of the organization's mobile banking applications across iOS and Android platforms. Mobile Developers are embedded within cross-functional Agile teams and play a critical role in delivering secure, reliable, and user-friendly digital experiences to millions of members. This role involves technical execution, platform advocacy, and collaboration across disciplines to ensure high-quality mobile solutions aligned with business goals and member needs.

Responsibilities

Design, develop, and maintain mobile banking features for iOS and/or Android platforms

Resolve production issues and contribute to platform stability and performance improvements

Collaborate with cross-functional Agile teams including front-end, back-end, and product stakeholders

Participate in Agile ceremonies and contribute to sprint planning and backlog refinement

Ensure adherence to platform-specific development standards and best practices

Write and maintain unit and UI tests; participate in peer code reviews

Stay current with mobile OS updates, development trends, and emerging technologies

Advocate for platform excellence and contribute to reusable component libraries

Mentor junior developers and contribute to team knowledge sharing

Support enterprise-wide mobile initiatives and influence platform strategy (senior levels)

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field

Progressive experience in mobile application development (level-dependent)

Proficiency in:

- iOS: Swift, Objective-C, Xcode

- Android: Kotlin, Java, Android Studio

Experience integrating RESTful APIs and third-party libraries

Familiarity with Agile methodologies (SAFe preferred)

Strong analytical, debugging, and problem-solving skills

Effective communication and collaboration abilities

Desired: Experience with CI/CD pipelines, mobile accessibility standards, and performance optimization

Career Levels - Please note that levels listed in the JD are so the vendors can see the difference in the levels. The HL is looking for a level 2, but will not be opposed if they are a 3 as that is categorized as a mid to Sr role. The role is open to all sites, not including microsites.

Associate Mobile Developer (Level 1)

Focus: Learning and foundational contribution

Technical Responsibilities:

Build small features and bug fixes under guidance

Participate in Agile ceremonies and code reviews

Learn platform tools and development practices

Pair with senior developers for mentorship

Soft Skills:

Curiosity

Adaptability

Clear communication

Team collaboration

Mobile Developer (Level 2)

Focus: Independent contribution and platform ownership

Technical Responsibilities:

Own moderately complex features and bug fixes

Represent mobile platform within Agile team

Collaborate with designers, analysts, and product owners

Begin mentoring junior developers

Soft Skills:

Accountability

Cross-functional communication

Proactive problem-solving

Senior Mobile Developer (Level 3)

Focus: Technical leadership and cross-team collaboration

Technical Responsibilities:

Lead development of complex features and platform initiatives

Influence architecture and reusable components

Mentor junior developers and drive platform standards

Represent mobile in cross-team efforts

Soft Skills:

Leadership

Strategic thinking

Coaching

Platform advocacy

Principal Mobile Developer (Level 4)

Focus: Vision-setting and enterprise-level influence

Technical Responsibilities:

Define mobile platform strategy across release trains

Lead enterprise-wide mobile initiatives and innovation

Introduce new tools, frameworks, and practices

Advocate for mobile excellence across the organization

Soft Skills:

Visionary leadership

Change management

Thought leadership

Enterprise collaboration

Job Title: Applications Dev & Test - Software Design Engineer 3
Job Description:
Job#: 3016240

Job Description:

Software Design Engineer 3 - Windows Hardware Security

Location: Hybrid- Redmond, WA (Onsite required due to access to specialized equipment, prototypes, and secure facilities)

Team: Windows & Devices - Hardware Security Engineering

Work Hours: Standard business hours (no remote time-zone flexibility)
About the Team

The Windows Hardware Security team is responsible for the foundational security of Windows laptop devices, including Surface. We design and implement the security processor, Trusted Platform Module (TPM), trusted boot flows, and the underlying hardware-rooted security features that protect millions of users.

As a Software Design Engineer 3, you will help shape the next generation of Windows device security, working directly on technologies that anchor Microsoft's security posture-such as the Pluton security chipset.


In this role, you will design, develop, implement, test, and maintain low-level software and firmware that power secure Windows boot, device identity, cryptographic operations, and hardware-rooted trust. You will work across firmware, OS components, drivers, and security subsystems to deliver robust, high-assurance security features for future Windows devices.

This position requires deep technical expertise in hardware security, cryptography, and low-level Windows development.







Candidates missing any of the above hard skills will not be eligible.
